Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4d401260bf1f0028079843?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn82@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-24-457_d3b979ce04a1fb0f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=fljft4rxQQY:iZb55I1xQAM:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-200_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-13-332_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=fljft4rxQQY:iZb55I1xQAM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn58@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-12-486_756f02275cd960c9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/fljft4rxQQY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn88@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-19-975_6ac825bac88050ca.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683396},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"Insiders say McDonald's former head of HR's 'gross and dirty' behavior sparked internal concerns long before his ouster in late 2019","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcdonalds-fired-head-of-hr-faces-renewed-scrutiny-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d204c7ffa48002894d261?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ronald mcdonald 2019\" height=\"2338\" width=\"3117\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Former McDonald&#39;s executives are under fire.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Noam Galai/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>McDonald's former head of HR David Fairhurst is facing renewed scrutiny as McDonald's sues ex-CEO Steve Easterbrook.&#160;</li><li>Heidi Capozzi, McDonald's head of HR, revealed during an internal meeting last week that Fairhurst was fired last November for making women at the company feel uncomfortable.&#160;</li><li>One former corporate staffer said he was disturbed by what he saw as Fairhurst's \"gross and dirty\" behavior when he was at the company, saying it sparked questions as to how seriously the company took HR complaints.&#160;</li><li>McDonald's has seen internal shakeups on its HR team recently, including the abrupt departure of Melanie Steinbach a month after she was promoted to the head of HR in the US.&#160;</li><li>McDonald's declined to comment further on Fairhurst and Steinbach's departures.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>McDonald's former head of HR David Fairhurst is facing renewed scrutiny, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcdonalds-slams-ex-ceo-steve-easterbrook-motion-to-dismiss-lawsuit-2020-8\">as the fast-food giant sues it ex-CEO Steve Easterbrook.&#160;</a></p><p>According to notes from the town hall viewed by Business Insider, McDonald's head of HR Heidi Capozzi said that she and CEO Chris Kempczinski are committed \"to the idea of transparency.\" While Capozzi said she is limited in some ways due to privacy concerns, she could share that Fairhurst was fired for cause based on an internal investigation.&#160;</p><p>Fairhurst was fired after making female McDonald's employees feel \"uncomfortable on numerous occasions at business events,\" Capozzi said during the meeting as first reported by <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/former-hr-chief-a-focus-of-mcdonalds-investigation-11598824305\">The Wall Street Journal,</a>&#160;</p><p>Fairhurst left McDonald's in November, shortly after Easterbrook was terminated by the company.&#160;</p><p>Easterbrook and Fairhurst both started their careers in McDonald's UK office. Both were known for drinking with McDonald's employees after work, The Wall Street Journal <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/mcdonalds-looks-beyond-party-culture-11578243600\">reported</a> in January.</p><p>Stories about Fairhurst drinking with employees &#8212; including younger female staffers &#8212; sparked rumors and ethical concerns, current and former employees and franchisees told Business Insider.&#160;</p><p>One holiday party in late 2018 prompted an investigation into Fairhurst's behavior. The head of HR was spotted pulling a female employee onto his lap, internal sources told Business Insider. The Journal reports that McDonald's investigated the incident, ultimately telling employees that such excessive drinking was inappropriate.</p><p>Fairhurst did not respond to Business Insider's request for comment. McDonald's declined to comment further on Fairhurst's exit.&#160;</p><h2>When the head of HR is misbehaving, how can employees report concerns?&#160;</h2><p>Personal experiences as well as recent reporting about Fairhurst have made current and former McDonald's employees and franchisees question the work of McDonald's HR department in recent years.&#160;</p><p>A former franchisee questioned how McDonald's HR team could have carried out corporate restructuring in a fair manner when the department was led by Fairhurst.</p><p>The Journal recently <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/mcdonalds-probe-into-ex-ceo-investigates-hr-department-cover-ups-11598398673?mod=hp_lead_pos1\">reported</a> some former employees said HR leaders under Fairhurst ignored internal complaints, and that employees feared retaliation if they reported others' actions to HR. These reports of misconduct, a former franchisee told Business Insider, now color his view of McDonald's 2018 corporate restructuring.&#160;</p><p>One former corporate staffer told Business Insider he was disturbed by what he saw as Fairhurst's \"gross and dirty\" behavior while drinking, which he saw first hand. If the head of HR was getting drunk with female staffers, he asked, how could anyone expect HR complaints to be taken seriously?&#160;</p><p>A current corporate employee said that, while Fairhurst was known for partying with subordinates several levels below him at the company, it was seen as more \"sad\" than \"gross.\" Prior to his departure, he was widely respected within the company, she said, even if he was seen as a bit pompous. This employee said she was not worried about Fairhurst's behavior impeding HR reports, in part because it would be rare for Fairhurst to handle a complaint alone.&#160;</p><p>\"We just thought he was a sad man who drank too much and weirdly didn't have friends outside of people who worked for him,\" she said.&#160;</p><h2>Executive shakeups continue on McDonald's HR team</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc03531e0ee7e45eb2be925?format=jpeg\" alt=\"McDonald&#39;s CEO Steve Easterbrook\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>McDonald&#39;s ex-CEO Steve Easterbrook.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Concerns about McDonald's HR department carry extra weight as<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcdonalds-slams-ex-ceo-steve-easterbrook-motion-to-dismiss-lawsuit-2020-8\"> McDonald's recently filed a lawsuit claiming that Easterbrook</a> engaged in multiple sexual relationships with employees during his time as CEO.&#160;</p><p>McDonald's sued Easterbrook earlier in August, claiming the CEO covered up sexual relationships with three employees at McDonald's during his last year leading the company. According to McDonald's complaint, investigators found dozens of sexually explicit photos of these employees attached to an email Easterbrook sent himself, after receiving an anonymous tip in July.&#160;</p><p>McDonald's terminated Easterbrook \"without cause\" in November 2019, after investigating a consensual relationship between the CEO and another female staffer.</p><p>Investigators said McDonald's did not know of any other inappropriate relationships at the time and that Easterbrook denied having sexual relationships with other employees. The company is now suing Easterbrook to claw back his multi-million dollar severance package.</p><p>McDonald's said last week it is also investigating if Easterbrook covered up other executives' misconduct, as well as allegations into the HR department during Easterbrook's time as CEO. McDonald's said in a statement that, \"The Board will follow the facts wherever they may lead.\"&#160;</p><p>McDonald's announced in March that Heidi Capozzi, formerly head of HR at Boeing Company, would replace Fairhurst as the new global chief people officer.&#160;</p><p>Melissa Kersey, who served as the&#160;head of HR in the US, left the company in late June. With Kersey's departure, McDonald's announced Melanie Steinbach would be promoted to the position of chief people officer in the US and Shammara Howell would take Steinbach's place as chief talent officer.</p><p>A month after she was promoted to the head of US HR and shortly after McDonald's filed its lawsuit against Easterbrook, Steinbach abruptly parted ways with the company. Prior to her departure earlier in August, her corporate email auto-reply indicated she was on \"medical leave.\" She did not respond to Business Insider's multiple requests for comment. McDonald's declined to comment on her departure.&#160;</p><p>Capozzi began a \"top-to-bottom\" review of the HR department after starting a global chief people officer in April, according to an executive.</p><p>When McDonald's filed its lawsuit against Easterbrook, Capozzi sent out a reminder on how employees can report \"concerns about behavior that is not in line with our values,\" according to a message viewed by Business Insider. In last week's town hall, Capozzi again told employees to share any concerns they might have and that the company has policies to prevent discrimination.&#160;</p><p><em>If you work or worked at McDonald's and have a story to share, email ktaylor@businessinsider.com.&#160;</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a -20-659_4eec8ed1061bc83a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683403},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"The Trump campaign has knowingly taken thousands of dollars from a neo-Nazi leader and other racists","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-accepted-money-from-neo-nazi-leader-other-racists-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d346060bf1f002807980f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"President Donald Trump attends a briefing during his visit to the nearby areas damaged by Hurricane Laura in Orange, Texas, U.S., August 29, 2020..JPG\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump attends a briefing during his visit to the nearby areas damaged by Hurricane Laura in Orange, Texas, U.S., August 29, 2020..JPG\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tom Brenner/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Morris Gulett, <a href=\"https://www.splcenter.org/fighting-hate/extremist-files/individual/morris-gulett\">a neo-Nazi leader</a> who created an outpost of the Aryan Nations in Louisiana, has donated at least $2,000 to President Donald Trump's reelection campaign, <a href=\"https://popular.info/p/trump-campaign-accepts-donations?token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjo4NDQ5NDksInBvc3RfaWQiOjkxOTc3NSwiXyI6ImErNVdLIiwiaWF0IjoxNTk4ODcwOTY4LCJleHAiOjE1OTg4NzQ1NjgsImlzcyI6InB1Yi0xNjY0Iiwic3ViIjoicG9zdC1yZWFjdGlvbiJ9.CmJynMxSxP1BHi9XGElDWf8xTEWqELUZ6SaczIcnqag\">according to data collected by Popular Information.</a></li><li>He has donated at least 29 times since 2017, and the Trump campaign was reportedly made aware of the donations in 2018 <a href=\"https://forward.com/news/national/406833/trump-keeps-white-supremacist-donations-to-2020-campaign/\">by The Forward</a>.</li><li>Popular Information detailed donations from several others, including businessman Peter Zieve, who was sued by Washington state over accusations of discriminating against minority employees.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>The Trump campaign has accepted thousands of dollars from racist extremists, including a neo-Nazi leader who runs an outpost of the Aryan Nations in Louisiana.</p><p><a href=\"https://popular.info/p/trump-campaign-accepts-donations?token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjo4NDQ5NDksInBvc3RfaWQiOjkxOTc3NSwiXyI6ImErNVdLIiwiaWF0IjoxNTk4ODcwOTY4LCJleHAiOjE1OTg4NzQ1NjgsImlzcyI6InB1Yi0xNjY0Iiwic3ViIjoicG9zdC1yZWFjdGlvbiJ9.CmJynMxSxP1BHi9XGElDWf8xTEWqELUZ6SaczIcnqag\">According to data collected by Popular Information, a politics newsletter written by journalist Judd Legum</a>, Morris Gulet, the leader of the Louisiana chapter of Aryan Nations, has donated at least $2,000 to the Trump campaign since December 2017.</p><p>The campaign was reportedly made aware of the donations in 2018 <a href=\"https://forward.com/news/national/406833/trump-keeps-white-supremacist-donations-to-2020-campaign/\">by The Forward</a>, though it has not returned the money.</p><p>So far Gulett, <a href=\"https://www.splcenter.org/fighting-hate/extremist-files/individual/morris-gulett\">who according to the Southern Poverty Law Center</a> is a senior pastor at the Church of Jesus Christ Christian, <a href=\"https://www.adl.org/education/resources/profiles/aryan-nations\">a nickname for Aryan Nations</a>, has made 29 contributions to the campaign.</p><p>The Trump campaign did not immediately respond to Insider's request for comment.</p><p>Popular Information also detailed a number of others who have donated to the Trump campaign, including businessman Peter Zieve, who was sued by Washington state over allegations of discriminating against minority employees, handing out \"procreation bonuses\" to his nearly all-white staff, and called immigrants from developing countries \"repulsive.\"</p><p>Zieve, who settled the lawsuit in 2017, has donated $5,600 to support Trump's campaign, Popular Information reported.</p><p>Other donors include Timothy Mellon and KC McAlpin. Mellon, a businessman who said social programs made Black people \"unwilling to pitch in to improve their own situations,\" donated to a Trump Super PAC, while McAlpin, an associate of John Tanton, who has founded a number of anti-immigrant groups, donated $1,600 to the campaign.</p><h2>Read Popular Information's <a href=\"https://popular.info/p/trump-campaign-accepts-donations?token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjo4NDQ5NDksInBvc3RfaWQiOjkxOTc3NSwiXyI6ImErNVdLIiwiaWF0IjoxNTk4ODcwOTY4LCJleHAiOjE1OTg4NzQ1NjgsImlzcyI6InB1Yi0xNjY0Iiwic3ViIjoicG9zdC1yZWFjdGlvbiJ9.CmJynMxSxP1BHi9XGElDWf8xTEWqELUZ6SaczIcnqag\">full report here</a>.</h2><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-unemployment-benefit-states-jobless-aid-lost-wages-lasts-month-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Trump's $300 unemployment benefit is set to be paid in 34 states. But the program may only provide aid for just over a month.</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/poll-more-us-troops-say-they-prefer-biden-to-trump-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">More US troops say they would vote for Biden than Trump as favorable views of the president fade among those serving in the military, new poll shows</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/john-kelly-illegal-trump-interactions-french-kissing-chainsaw-book-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Former Trump chief of staff John Kelly says telling the president that things he wanted to do were illegal was like 'French kissing a chainsaw'</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wisconsin-governor-tony-evers-trump-letter-reconsider-kenosha-visit-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers sends letter to Trump asking to 'reconsider' visit to Kenosha: 'I am concerned your presence will only hinder our healing'</a></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/h7aY-GqUw6M\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:19:45 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4d34f660bf1f0028079810?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"50cc6a7bca2c5faf1f7bf3ad1208ba0d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn64@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-08-241_5b0ce9c2b7a50a9e.webp","destWidth":1761,"destHeight":1321,"sourceBytes":106216,"destBytes":106216,"author":"kmclaughlin@businessinsider.com (Kelly McLaughlin)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4d346060bf1f002807980f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn41@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-19-585_2f209f14efef2adb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=h7aY-GqUw6M:bSqYuaYh4I4:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-200_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-13-332_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=h7aY-GqUw6M:bSqYuaYh4I4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn86@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-15-159_571de367dcc8c43a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/h7aY-GqUw6M":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn8@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-18-777_9d5117e107ff04ad.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683395},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"A new book showcases real-life places around the world that look straight out of a Wes Anderson film — here's an early look at the fantastical dupes","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/accidentally-wes-anderson-book-film-instagram-travel-community-social-media-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d74797ffa48002894d460?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Accidentally West Anderson 4x3\" height=\"3000\" width=\"4000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fox Searchlight Pictures/Courtesy Accidentally Wes Anderson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>The founder of the popular Instagram account <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/accidentallywesanderson/?hl=en\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a> is releasing his first-ever book highlighting 200 of the \"most idiosyncratic and interesting locations on Earth.\"</li><li>Images in the book span every continent including Antarctica and echo filmmaker Wes Anderson's distinctive and whimsical visual style.</li><li>Titled \"<a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a>,\" the book is available now for preorder and will be released on October 20.</li><li>Founder Wally Koval and his wife, Amanda, also plan to launch a searchable database of Wes Anderson-inspired images close to the book's release date.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>The places in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/wes-anderson\">Wes Anderson</a> films are the stuff of travelers' dreams.</p><p>Take The Grand Budapest Hotel, a perfectly symmetrical, pastel pink structure perched on mountains in the Republic of Zubrowka that looks like its windows are frosted in icing. It has 370 reviews and a close-to-five-star rating on <a href=\"https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g6840479-d6776131-Reviews-or5-The_Grand_Budapest_Hotel-The_Republic_of_Zubrowka.html#REVIEWS\">TripAdvisor</a>.</p><p>The only problem? It doesn't actually exist. \"This is a fictional place ... Please do not try to book a visit here,\" TripAdvisor writes at the top of The Grand Budapest Hotel's listing.</p><p>This hasn't deterred Brooklyn-based traveler Wally Koval from searching for Anderson-esque places anyway.</p><p>Since 2017, Koval and his wife, Amanda, have spent countless hours combing Instagram for images of real places around the world that emulate Anderson's distinct visual style and posting them to their Instagram account \"<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/accidentallywesanderson/?hl=en\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a>.\" In each caption, they include background about where each place is and how to visit.</p><p>What started out as an account with 15 followers has transformed into a community of 1.1 million followers. Now they're releasing their first book, \"Accidentally Wes Anderson.\"</p><p>Currently available for preorder and releasing October 20, the book features 200 of the \"<a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">most interesting and idiosyncratic places on Earth</a>,\" whittled down from 15,000 submissions. The images, submitted by photographers hailing from over 50 countries, span every continent including Antarctica, Koval told Business Insider. They range from grand palaces to grandstands in the middle of nowhere and are accompanied by in-depth stories about how each place came to be.</p><p>More than half of the images in the book have never been featured on the Instagram feed before, and those that have date back to the account's early years, Koval said.</p><h2>While the Accidentally Wes Anderson aesthetic has certain bread-and-butter qualities &#8212; symmetry, pastel colors, and a straight-on perspective &#8212; there is a certain<em> je ne sais quois</em> that Koval hasn't quite put his finger on</h2><p>Whatever that<em>&#160;je ne sais quois</em> is, it has the real Wes Anderson's stamp of approval: \"The photographs in this book were taken by people I have never met, of places and things I have, almost without exception, never seen &#8212; but I must say: I intend to,\" the filmmaker <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/wes-anderson-writes-foreword-for-accidentally-wes-anderson-photobook-2020-8\">writes in the forward</a>.&#160;</p><p>As for the 14,000-plus images that <em>didn't</em> make it into the book, they won't go unseen. Around the book's release date, Wally and Amanda plan to launch an online database, where visitors can look up Accidentally Wes Anderson images by location, color, and photographer.</p><p>The website will cater to the evolving Accidentally Wes Anderson community. \"People aren't just exchanging information about their travels,\" Koval said. \"People are also utilizing what we've created for their design &#8212; interior design and mood boards and things &#8212; which I never expected.\"</p><p>Ahead of the book's release date and the database launch, Koval shared a selection of images and snippets of stories behind the images with Business Insider.</p><p>From a mustard yellow funicular railway car in Lisbon to bright pink cottages in California, here's an early look at some of the destinations featured in \"Accidentally Wes Anderson\":</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tRoberts Cottages\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0c5f7ffa48002894d1e5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"063 oceanside cabins @paulfuentes_photo\" height=\"2500\" width=\"1750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">@paulfuentes_photo / Courtesy Accidentally Wes Anderson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Location:</strong> Oceanside, California</p><p><strong>Photographer:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/paulfuentes_photo/?hl=en\">@paulfuentes_photo</a></p><p><strong>From the book:</strong> \"Today, these rental bungalows still stand, representing an important moment in Oceanside's nascent days, a time when the town enticed visitors with the tremendous promise that 'If you long for a beautiful country, with a matchless climate, come to Oceanside, where life is worth living.'\"</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a></em></p>\n\tHotel Opera\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0c6060bf1f0028079734?format=jpeg\" alt=\"070 hotel opera @valentina_jacks\" height=\"2500\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">@valentina_jacks / Courtesy Accidentally Wes Anderson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Location:</strong> Prague, Czech Republic</p><p><strong>Photographer:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/valentina_jacks/?hl=en\">@valentina_jacks</a></p><p><strong>From the book: </strong>\"A hot-pink confection of Bohemian Neo-Renaissance style, the Hotel Opera stands in the less touristy Nov&#233; Město, or 'New Town,' quarter of storied Prague. It is a five-minute walk from historic Old Town &#8212; an apt reflection of Prague's nonlinear relationship to time. This romantic city is a unique meeting ground for old and new, historic and modern. Miraculously preserved buildings established in the fourteenth century are squeezed beside ultramodern constructions, like a Frank Gehry&#8211;designed glass building that resembles a dancing couple. And yet nothing feels out of place in this enchanted, haunted city &#8212; including the bright pink Hotel Opera ... which is not particularly near the Opera.\"</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a></em></p>\n\tAscensor da Bica\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0c6160bf1f0028079736?format=jpeg\" alt=\"047 lisbon tram @jackspiceradams\" height=\"2500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">@jackspiceradams / Courtesy Accidentally Wes Anderson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Location: </strong>Lisbon, Portugal</p><p><strong>Photographer:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/jackspiceradams/?hl=en\">@jackspiceradams</a></p><p><strong>From the book:</strong> \"One of three funicular railway cars in Lisbon, Ascensor (or Elevador) da Bica climbs 800 feet up one of the city's steepest hills.\"</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a></em></p>\n\tPost Office\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0c6060bf1f0028079735?format=jpeg\" alt=\"102 postmaster alaska @heath_travels\" height=\"2322\" width=\"2500\" </strong>Alaska</p><p><strong>Photographer:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/heath_travels/?hl=en\">@heath_travels</a></p><p><strong>From the book:</strong> \"In this community of 3,000, there is a Post office, and a Postmaster (per the sign on the door), but no one delivers the mail.\"</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a></em></p>\n\tCrawley Edge Boat Shed\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0c5c7ffa48002894d1e4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"161 crawley edge boat shed blue boat house @_JamesWong href=\"https://www.instagram.com/_jameswong/?hl=en\">@_JamesWong</a></p><p><strong>From the book:</strong> \"The numbers of tourists have grown so overwhelming that in 2019 the city of Perth decided to spend $400,000 on a solar-powered toilet facility to serve them.\"</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a></em></p>\n\tAmer Fort\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0c5e60bf1f0028079733?format=jpeg\" alt=\"039 amer fort @chrsschlkx\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p absurd attention to clever details you would never know about from looking at the exterior architecture.\"</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a></em></p>\n\tWhite Cyclone Rollercoaster\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0c5e60bf1f0028079732?format=jpeg\" alt=\"150 spa land rollercoaster japan @paulhiller\" height=\"2500\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">@paulhiller / Courtesy Accidentally Wes Anderson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Location:</strong> Nagashima Spa Land, Kuwana, Mie, Japan</p><p><strong>Photographer:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/paulhiller/?hl=en\">@paulhiller</a></p><p><strong>From the book: </strong>\"Wooden coasters are extremely rare in Japan, a country with strong regulations on tree felling; the Cyclone was constructed with enough timber to build nearly a thousand homes.\"</p><p><em>Source: <a trains between San Antonio and El Paso. Its name actually means 'Martha' in Russian and was named for an unlikely character.\"</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a></em></p>\n\tCologne Cable Car\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0c5b7ffa48002894d1e3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"188 cable car cathedral germany @olle.l.olle\" height=\"2500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">@olle.l.olle / Courtesy Accidentally Wes Anderson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Location:</strong> Colgone, Germany</p><p><strong>Photographer:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/olle.l.olle/?hl=en\">@olle.l.olle</a></p><p><strong>From the book:</strong> \"The Cologne Cable Car company (K&#246;lner Seilbahn or Rheinseilbahn) carries bright-red four-seat gondolas on a fifteen-minute, half-mile journey above the Rhine River.\"</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a></em></p>\n\tGlenorchy Wharf Shed\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0c6160bf1f0028079737?format=jpeg\" alt=\"034 glenorchy wharf shed @friiidaberg\" height=\"2500\" width=\"2390\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">@friiidaberg / Courtesy Accidentally Wes Anderson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Location:</strong> Glenorchy, New Zealand</p><p><strong>Photographer:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/friiidaberg/?hl=en\">@friiidaberg</a></p><p><strong>From the book:</strong> \"By the mid-1950s, the 250 full-time citizens of the town came together and initiated a push for a road to connect Glenorchy to Queenstown. Though supported by many, the execution of the project was engineered by two remarkable individuals, each fueled by willpower and love ... with extra assistance from a nudge of fate.\"</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.accidentallywesanderson.com/book/\">Accidentally Wes Anderson</a></em></p>\n\tKoval takes pride in offering moments of escapism to followers of Accidentally Wes Anderson, he told Business Insider.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d0cbb60bf1f0028079739?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Wally and Amanda Koval_BTHS_6\" height=\"1836\" width=\"1964\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Wally Koval (right) and his wife, Amanda, are the masterminds behind Accidentally Wes Anderson.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy Wally Koval</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"What we try to put out there is this moment of delight,\" he said of the images he and Amanda post. \"It doesn't have to put a giant smile on your face. It doesn't have to make you jump up and down for joy. It's not this, you know, big experience. It's just [<em>exhales sigh of relief</em>] 'Oh, that's nice.' That's not something that we get anymore. Nobody has that. In the world, it's not a normal feeling anymore.\"</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 22:26:23 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"The best golf balls","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-golf-ball","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Like picking out the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-golf-clubs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">right clubs</a>, choosing which golf ball to use for a day spent on the links is an important decision &#8212; and not all are created equal.</strong></li><li><strong>Whether you're just learning the game of golf or have several years of the sport under your belt, you'll want to make sure you find a ball suited to your play style and preference &#8212; and just because you like the balls the pros use on the weekends, doesn't mean you'll have the same outcome they do.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>To help, we've tested a variety of the top golf balls currently available from brands like Titleist, TaylorMade, and Callaway to find the best for a variety of golfers.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>Our top pick, the <a href=\"http://amzn.to/2HW4X7i\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Titleist Tour Soft golf ball</a>, delivers outstanding performance and feel, and has a distance that'll work nicely for any mid- to low-handicap players.</strong></li></ul><p>One of the best things about the game of golf is that you can test yourself on many of the same courses and hole distances the pros you watch on television play. Better yet, you're even able to use some of the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-golf-shoes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">same equipment</a> they use to make the weekend cut.&#160;</p><p>Of course, once you take a look at the cost of some of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-golf-driver\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the drivers</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-golf-irons\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">irons</a> the pros use, you may want to seek out a cheaper way of copying your favorite pro's game. One way to do that is to pick up a pack of the same golf balls they use. No matter if it's Tiger's signature Bridgestone ball or Jordan Spieth's Titelists, picking up a pack of the same brand or style takes little more than a simple Google search.</p><p>And perhaps the golf skill to pull off using a ball intended for elite golfers.&#160;</p><h3>How to shop for golf balls</h3><p>Even though it may feel cool to use the same ball as whoever just won the Masters, you're highly unlikely to receive the same performance from that pro-level golf ball as the pro does. Pro-level balls react differently to the skills professional players have versus the talent of the occasional weekend golfer's skill level.&#160;</p><p>This means that those balls are often fine-tuned to respond exactly as that golfer sees fit. If they favor a fade shot while driving on the fairway, then a golfer who tends to draw will likely have a far different experience. The contact sweet spot which allows for greater driving distances can also be much smaller which may produce more off-the-mark strikes for less accurate golfers.&#160;</p><p>But even if you aren't yet cut out for the PGA Tour, it doesn't mean you have to ditch seeking out your favorite golfer's preferred ball altogether. Different levels of golf balls are available to meet the needs of different players, both in terms of skill and in terms of price. So, maybe you can play with a ball from the same company as your favorite pro but just choose a level or two lower than what they use.</p><p>To help, we've tested a variety of golf balls from a who's who in the industry such as Callaway, Titleist, and TaylorMade to find the best currently available. And don't fret, our guide includes picks for every skill level and type of player, too.&#160;</p><h2>Here are the best golf balls:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best golf ball overall: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Titleist Tour Soft</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best ball for amateurs to learn to spin: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B078S38X4Y/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B078S38X4Y&linkId=6947f4262842e431bc49fbf0336ad91e2842e431bc49fbf0336ad91e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">TaylorMade Project (a)</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best golf ball for straight flight: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N42J7LF/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B01N42J7LF&linkId=d57bf0f81077e12a7ff96c209f8999d21077e12a7ff96c209f8999d2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Bridgestone e6 Speed</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best value golf ball: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N1U84M9/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B01N1U84M9&linkId=47416ff34890adad2806d67ae5ed42454890adad2806d67ae5ed4245\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Callaway Warbird</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best high-end golf ball: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07JP9J2KG/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07JP9J2KG&linkId=02b38d79fc11f61851ce0d93c587c780fc11f61851ce0d93c587c780\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Titleist Pro V1</a></strong></li></ul><p><em>Updated on 8/31/2020 by Rick Stella: Updated the section on how to shop for golf balls, checked the availability of each recommended set, and updated the prices and links where necessary.&#160;</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best golf ball overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ab2bbe4f996343d058b46d8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best golf ball\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Titleist</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0789695SV/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0789695SV&#38;linkId=a166eaae92af5185817f25a5a2d36b11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Titleist Tour Soft</a> has been redesigned for better distance and feel versus other two-layer golf balls.</h3><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0789695SV/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0789695SV&#38;linkId=a166eaae92af5185817f25a5a2d36b11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Titleist Tour Soft golf ball</a> is a new&#160;ball from one of the best golf ball makers around, and it delivers a great mix of distance and feel. Whether it will be as popular as its predecessors &#8212; the Titleist NXT Tour and the Tour S &#8212; remains to be seen, but it's an interesting choice at a great price.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0789695SV/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0789695SV&#38;linkId=a166eaae92af5185817f25a5a2d36b11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Tour Soft</a> is a two-layer golf ball with an extremely thin cover, which may leave some golfers skeptical that it can deliver the performance of a three- or four-layer ball. Titleist is banking on the huge core to give advanced golfers the control they want and expect from a multiple-layer ball.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0789695SV/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0789695SV&#38;linkId=a166eaae92af5185817f25a5a2d36b11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Titleist</a> redesigned the cover on the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0789695SV/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0789695SV&#38;linkId=a166eaae92af5185817f25a5a2d36b11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Tour Soft ball</a>, making it with a mix of materials, to better handle the large core that allows for greater exit velocity for the ball.</p><p>The thinner cover delivers feel and spin. <a href=\"http://golf-info-guide.com/golf-ball-tests-and-reviews/titleist-tour-soft-golf-ball-review/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Golf Info Guide</a> says the Tour Soft should give you a better level of feel than the balls it's attempting to replace. However, it's a little more difficult to spin the Tour Soft on short approach shots and chip shots than some other high-level golf balls.</p><p>The softness of the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0789695SV/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0789695SV&#38;linkId=a166eaae92af5185817f25a5a2d36b11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Titleist Tour Soft</a> is noticeable on the greens, too. It takes far less force to putt with this ball, which should give you more control over your stroke on long putts.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Smart new design gives you more feel than a normal two-layer ball, huge core delivers more exit speed and distance, offered at a reasonable price point for a newly designed ball</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Spin control on chip shots lags a little bit, only a two-layer ball, which leaves some golfers skeptical</p>\n\tThe best golf ball for amateurs\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ab2bc7a5bd8b81a008b4733?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best golf ball 2\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">TaylorMade</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>When you want to learn how to spin a golf ball on approach shots, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B078S38X4Y/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B078S38X4Y&#38;linkId=6947f4262842e431bc49fbf0336ad91e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">TaylorMade Project (a) golf ball</a> will give you more control than most balls aimed at bogey-level golfers.</strong></h3><p>One of the best ways for mid-level amateur players to make a jump in their scores is to improve their performance on approach shots and around the green. To become a high-level golfer, learning how to spin the ball off iron and wedge shots will help quite a bit, as the right spin can help you keep the ball closer to the pin.</p><p>When you're just learning how to spin and control the ball, the best ball to help you is the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B078S38X4Y/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B078S38X4Y&#38;linkId=6947f4262842e431bc49fbf0336ad91e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">TaylorMade Project (a)</a>. This ball, which has been upgraded in 2018, carries a high spin rate when struck properly.</p><p>Of course, if you don't strike it properly, it can cause a greater severity of hook or slice, which means this <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B078S38X4Y/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B078S38X4Y&#38;linkId=6947f4262842e431bc49fbf0336ad91e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">TaylorMade</a> ball probably isn't the best choice for high-handicap golfers. Still, this ball can potentially help a bogey golfer to start consistently shooting in the 80s.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B078S38X4Y/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B078S38X4Y&#38;linkId=6947f4262842e431bc49fbf0336ad91e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">TaylorMade</a> uses a three-layer design to give the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B078S38X4Y/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B078S38X4Y&#38;linkId=6947f4262842e431bc49fbf0336ad91e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Project (a) golf ball</a> its high level of spin. The better spin results should give mid-level handicappers the ability to keep the ball closer to the pin on approach shots, leading to shorter putts and better scores.&#160;However, you may notice more spin off the face of the driver, too.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>High level of spin on approach and chip shots, good price point for such a responsive ball, TaylorMade recently gave ball a slight design upgrade, three-layer construction works great for many levels of golfers</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Mis-hits will slice or hook more severely than other balls, thin cover on the ball will scuff easily</p>\n\tThe best golf ball for straight flight\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ab2bd55b0284719008b473f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best golf ball 3\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bridgestone</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>For less-skilled golfers, golf balls with high levels of spin could lead to more severe slices and hooks, so the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N42J7LF/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01N42J7LF&#38;linkId=d57bf0f81077e12a7ff96c209f8999d2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Bridgestone e6 Speed golf ball's</a> promise of less spin makes it a great choice.</strong></h3><p>One of the biggest frustrations for mid-to-high-handicap golfers is hitting the ball straight. It doesn't take long to ruin a solid score by slicing your drive on the 12th hole into the trees and taking five shots to work your way out.</p><p>Certainly, improving your swing is the best way to avoid unwanted slices and hooks that leave you in big trouble off the tee. The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N42J7LF/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01N42J7LF&#38;linkId=d57bf0f81077e12a7ff96c209f8999d2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Bridgestone e6 Speed golf ball</a> can help you stay straighter off the tee, too, while also delivering a nice level of distance.</p><p>These golf balls carry a really nice price point, closer to the value end of the market than the top end and it works well for amateur players who don't have a high club speed and exit velocity rate for the ball.</p><p>Don't expect to have a lot of spin control with these <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N42J7LF/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01N42J7LF&#38;linkId=d57bf0f81077e12a7ff96c209f8999d2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Bridgestone balls</a>, though, as the design of the e6 Speed causes for a slower spin rate, which provides a straighter shot.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N42J7LF/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01N42J7LF&#38;linkId=d57bf0f81077e12a7ff96c209f8999d2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Bridgestone</a> is betting on the fact that for most amateur golfers who are fighting their swings a bit, a straighter ball is more beneficial than a spin control ball. The company uses a three-layer construction with the e6 Speed, but its middle layer works to reduce spin, rather than enhance spin like many three-layer balls.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Designed to reduce the spin of the golf ball for straighter shots, when struck properly should give you a bit more distance, works well for amateur players who don't have a high club speed, nice price point</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Less backspin means it can be tougher to hold the green, not really made for advanced players who want ball control</p>\n\tThe best value golf ball\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ab2be7f410e8419008b470a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best golf ball 4\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Callaway</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>Even though it carries a value price point, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N1U84M9/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01N1U84M9&#38;linkId=4d0cedd30c9685963c7e7e6d70281646\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Callaway Warbird golf ball</a> will give mid-to-high-handicap golfers really nice performance, especially in terms of distance.</strong></h3><p>If you miss the old days where nearly every ball was a two-layer golf ball and where distance was the primary concern, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N1U84M9/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01N1U84M9&#38;linkId=4d0cedd30c9685963c7e7e6d70281646\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Callaway Warbird</a> will give you that old school performance.</p><p>Don't mistake the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N1U84M9/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01N1U84M9&#38;linkId=4d0cedd30c9685963c7e7e6d70281646\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Warbird</a> as an old-time golf ball design, though. Callaway has created the Warbird with an extremely thin outer layer, which is common on modern golf balls. Yet, the company was able to maintain a low price point for these golf balls.</p><p>Even though the Warbird uses a really thin cover to try to maximize softness and feel, it's the excellent distance you'll receive with this ball that'll grab your attention. This two-layer design features a soft core that is larger than average, helping to give you good distance performance.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01N1U84M9/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01N1U84M9&#38;linkId=4d0cedd30c9685963c7e7e6d70281646\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Callaway Warbird's distance</a> is impressive, especially off the tee. The aerodynamics of the dimple design on the surface of the golf ball allow it to perform well in windy conditions.</p><p>With its large core, the Warbird delivers a higher level of exit velocity off the clubface than other types of value-priced golf balls, which results in more distance. It will better serve a high handicap player or a beginning player who isn't concerned about ball spin. The value price point of the Warbird also fits this type of player better.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Very nice price point, delivers a good distance off the tee and out of the fairway versus similarly priced balls, works nicely for beginning players, performs better than expected during high wind conditions</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Doesn't give you a great sense of feel, only a two-layer golf ball that won't help low-handicap players</p>\n\tThe best high-end golf ball\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ab2bf24e2a73e6d0b8b46aa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best golf ball 5\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Titleist</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>Low handicappers will be able to control the new version of the <a href=\"http://dicks-sporting-goods.ryvx.net/c/196318/315573/4835?subId1=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dickssportinggoods.com%2Fp%2Ftitleist-pro-v1-golf-balls-prior-generation-17ttlm2017prv1xxxgbl%2F17ttlm2017prv1xxxgbl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Titleist Pro V1</a> like they always have, but they'll also receive a straighter and longer ball flight.</strong></h3><p>If you've paid attention to golf ball technology in the past couple of decades, you've almost certainly heard of the <a href=\"http://dicks-sporting-goods.ryvx.net/c/196318/315573/4835?subId1=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dickssportinggoods.com%2Fp%2Ftitleist-pro-v1-golf-balls-prior-generation-17ttlm2017prv1xxxgbl%2F17ttlm2017prv1xxxgbl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Titleist Pro V1</a>. This golf ball has been in regular play since 2000 among low-handicap players.</p><p>Because of its nearly two-decade lifespan, you may be tempted to ignore the Pro V1 these days. However, don't let this top-of-the-line Titleist ball's age deceive you. Titleist's designers have continually improved the <a href=\"http://dicks-sporting-goods.ryvx.net/c/196318/315573/4835?subId1=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dickssportinggoods.com%2Fp%2Ftitleist-pro-v1-golf-balls-prior-generation-17ttlm2017prv1xxxgbl%2F17ttlm2017prv1xxxgbl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Pro V1</a> over the years, and the latest upgrade, done last year, keeps this ball at the top of its game.</p><p>It delivers exactly the feel and performance you'd expect, yet it's still a better ball than previous high-end Titleist balls, which is no small feat for Titleist's designers to have achieved.</p><p>The new <a href=\"http://dicks-sporting-goods.ryvx.net/c/196318/315573/4835?subId1=biipgf_032218_best-golf-balls&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dickssportinggoods.com%2Fp%2Ftitleist-pro-v1-golf-balls-prior-generation-17ttlm2017prv1xxxgbl%2F17ttlm2017prv1xxxgbl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Titleist Pro V1</a> design still uses a three-layer construction with a solid rubber core, a soft mantle layer, and an outer urethane cover. The primary difference in the latest version of the ball is that the large core doesn't spin as much, providing greater distance without sacrificing the feel of the ball that the cover and mantle layers provide.</p><p>The ball achieves a great level of spin for low handicap players while giving you a consistent flight, thanks in part to the impressive dimple pattern. The Pro V1 now offers 352 dimples that cover the ball more evenly, helping create a better flight path.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>New dimple design allows for straighter ball flight, yields excellent spin control on approach shots, will give low handicap golfers a good feel for shots, brand and model that's been at the top of the game for almost two decades</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Very expensive golf ball, new version from last year isn't massively different from previous version</p>\n\tWhat to look for in a golf ball\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ab2c09ca042511d008b4708?format=jpeg\" alt=\"early morning golfer\" height=\"1332\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sam Greenwood/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong>Levels of golf balls</strong></h3><ul style=\"list-style-type: disc; padding-left: 30px; font-family: Georgia,Times,sans-serif;\"><li><strong>Tour: </strong>A tour-level ball is one that professional golfers play with.&#160;These are the most expensive golf balls, and they'll give you a high level of distance and spin control performance.</li><li><strong>Premium: </strong>The premium level ball fits in the mid-range of the golf ball market, both in terms of price and performance.&#160;Average players will receive a nice ball that can enhance their games and help them work on shot-making at the same time.</li><li><strong>Value: </strong>Inexpensive balls tend to have a limited number of features, but they'll work well for beginning and high-handicap players who are still developing their skills. They have a low price point, and many of them will work to yield a straight ball flight, which is nice for players who tend to mis-hit the ball more often.</li></ul><p>Most mid-to-high-handicap players don't have the skills to manipulate a tour-level golf ball. If you cannot spin the ball to make certain types of shots, a premium-to-value-level golf ball should serve you well.</p><p>When your skills have advanced to the point where you're ready to try spinning and controlling the ball more precisely, you may want to switch to a high-end tour ball.</p><h3><strong>Design features of golf balls</strong></h3><p>Golf balls may look nearly identical on the outside, but the interior of the ball will vary quite a bit from model to model.</p><ul style=\"list-style-type: disc; padding-left: 30px; font-family: Georgia,Times,sans-serif;\"><li><strong>Compression: </strong>The compression level of a golf ball measures the deflection of the ball when the club strikes it. You can see this compression in a series of high-speed photographs. An average compression rating on a ball will be 90 to 100. Higher compression rated golf balls require more club speed to compress the ball and create distance, but they tend to fly straighter. A lower compression rated golf ball achieves good distance even with a slower club speed&#160;but it may not be as easy to control.</li><li><strong>Layers: </strong>Golf balls can consist of anywhere from one to five layers. The rubber has a different consistency and thickness in each layer, too. Balls with more layers tend to cost more, as they're aimed at experienced players looking to gain more spin control. Designers can affect the distance and spin of the ball by making slight adjustments to the layers.&#160;</li><li><strong>Spin: </strong>The design of the ball can lead to a high, average, or low level of spin. Balls that generate more spin off the clubface give low-handicap golfer more control around the green. Such balls typically have more layers but with a higher level of spin, mis-hit balls can slice or hook more severely than low-spin balls, which are aimed at beginning players.</li></ul><p>Most golf balls are white, but you also can find bright yellow, orange, and pink golf balls.&#160;Color doesn't really affect the performance of the ball, but some people find it easier to follow the track of a yellow or orange ball in the sky.</p><p>You also may have an easier time finding a brightly colored ball in the rough or in the trees versus a white ball, should you spend a lot of your golf round in those areas.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/best-golf-ball'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
