396},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"The best garden hoses","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-garden-hose","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>If you have plants to water, a car to wash, or a sprinkler to connect so the kids can splash around this summer, then you're going to need a good garden hose. </strong></li><li><strong>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00XXN0J7K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00XXN0J7K&linkId=e2bf7b695f07d4d24dab3108e7a4c5965f07d4d24dab3108e7a4c596\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Craftsman Premium Rubber Garden Hose</a> is our top pick because it's a flexible, durable, all-weather hose that's made in America and backed by a lifetime warranty.</strong></li></ul><p>I bought two absurdly cheap hoses shortly after my wife and I moved into our first house. I spent the better part of a year wrangling tangles and bends, trying and failing to make even coils after use, and soon enough, wrapping plumber's tape around numerous dripping punctures, cracks, and tears. Long story short, if you buy a cheap hose, you get a cheap hose.</p><p>I researched and testes a variety of garden hoses to find the best ones for different needs. While budget is definitely a factor, if you need it for all your watering, washing, and summer fun projects, you'll want something durable and easy to coil. The frustration of using a shoddy garden hose ranks up there with multiple paper cuts and burned out bulbs on holiday light strands.</p><p>For the smaller property, a coiled or expandable hose minimizes space occupied during storage.&#160;</p><p>A super-strong steel-plated hose might be great for the home with a dog who tends to chew on things, but might not be ideal for someone who has trouble lifting heavier objects.</p><h2>Here are the best garden hoses:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best overall: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00XXN0J7K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00XXN0J7K&linkId=e2bf7b695f07d4d24dab3108e7a4c5965f07d4d24dab3108e7a4c596\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Craftsman Premium Rubber Garden Hose</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best lightweight hose: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003P9XAAU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B003P9XAAU&linkId=2b715d98770b0e072ad4a82c0fe751c3770b0e072ad4a82c0fe751c3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Water Right 400 Series Slim &#38; Light Garden Hose</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best coiled hose: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0793J5QG9/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B0793J5QG9&linkId=7257ebb6db907277d9244b368ef81d3edb907277d9244b368ef81d3e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Orbit 26380 50-Foot Coil Hose</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best expandable hose: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PJ49J9J/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07PJ49J9J&linkId=566e459d31984c371a894a8af74a6f4531984c371a894a8af74a6f45\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Aterod Expandable Garden Hose</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best steel hose: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07H2SXM8C/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07H2SXM8C&linkId=16cf22724328197084256ec33cc902024328197084256ec33cc90202\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Tardigrade 50-Foot Steel Hose</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best irrigation hose: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07P9FCR7D/ref=as_li_tl?imprToken=cYkqSnisLw.8Rjvvqn4R9g&slotNum=29&ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=w61&creativeASIN=B00BX21RPQ&linkId=ab4431acefc90b8b34f58ca850f26f81&th=11acefc90b8b34f58ca850f26f81&#38;th=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Melnor Flat Soaker Garden Hose</a></strong></li></ul><p><em>Prices and links are current as of 8/31/2020.&#160;</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5accebf0c407b32c388b486c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best garden hose\" height=\"631\" width=\"841\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Craftsman</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00XXN0J7K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00XXN0J7K&#38;linkId=e2bf7b695f07d4d24dab3108e7a4c596\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Craftsman Premium Rubber Garden Hose&#160;</a>will last a lifetime &#8212; guaranteed &#8212; and it doesn't get twisted easily.&#160;</h3><p>If I weren't already calling the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00XXN0J7K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00XXN0J7K&#38;linkId=e2bf7b695f07d4d24dab3108e7a4c596\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Craftsman Premium Rubber Garden Hose</a> a superlative product based on its quality, I'd call it a great buy simply due to its price. This rugged, capable hose could easily sell for double its price tag thanks to its durability.</p><p>It just might be the last hose you buy, in fact, unless you run over it with a lawnmower. And yes, I've cut short the life of a hose that way (OK, two), though thankfully not a Craftsman.</p><p>The thick yet pliant rubber used in the construction of this hose remains flexible and resists cracking even in temperatures down to 25 degrees below zero (Fahrenheit). It is safe for use with water as hot as 160 degrees, which is dozens of degrees hotter than you'll probably ever run through it anyway.&#160;</p><p>The nickel-plated brass hardware is crush-proof and corrosion-resistant, and the octagonal exterior shape of the couplings makes it easy to twist the hose onto or off of a spigot, sprinkler, sprayer, and so forth.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Exceptional durability, works in extreme temperatures, kink-resistant</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Leaves scuff marks on some surfaces, only 25 feet long&#160;</p>\n\tThe best lightweight hose\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5accec9bf41c7819008b4eaa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best garden hose\" height=\"609\" width=\"812\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Water Right</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003P9XAAU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B003P9XAAU&#38;linkId=2b715d98770b0e072ad4a82c0fe751c3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">50-foot Water Right 400 Series Slim &#38; Light Garden Hose</a> weighs less than many garden hoses that are half its length yet it still delivers plenty of water pressure and volume.</h3><p>If you think dealing with a heavy garden hose is no big deal, then you have clearly never dealt with a heavy garden hose. I had a 110-foot long monster hose a few years back, and I guarantee my neighbors learned new curse words listening to me haul the thing around our property.</p><p>Even many 50-foot hoses can weigh more than 10 pounds when dry, with any water trapped in the tube adding lots of extra weight. For many, a heavy hose can be a serious hindrance to gardening, cleaning, and other such projects.</p><p>With the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003P9XAAU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B003P9XAAU&#38;linkId=2b715d98770b0e072ad4a82c0fe751c3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Water Right 400 Series Slim and Light Garden Hose</a>, weight is not an issue. This slender flexible hose weighs scarcely more than three pounds, so you can move about with ease while using it, distributing water anywhere you need up to 50 feet away from the source.</p><p>Made with sturdy, durable polyurethane, it also resists permanent kinks and is safe to use in sub-freezing conditions or in temperatures hotter than any yet recorded on earth. (Which was 134 degrees Fahrenheit, recorded in Death Valley, CA on July 10, 1913 in case you were wondering.)</p><p>It's also free of lead, BPA, and phthalates, so you don't have to worry about dangerous chemicals leaching into your soil.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Lightweight and flexible, resists permanent kinks</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Expensive<a href=\"https://amzn.to/2GOFgcZ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"></a></p>\n\tThe best coiled hose\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5acced03c407b3b5378b48cd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best coiled garden hose\" height=\"611\" width=\"815\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Orbit</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0793J5QG9/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0793J5QG9&#38;linkId=7257ebb6db907277d9244b368ef81d3e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Orbit 26380 50-Foot Coil Hose</a> is ready to stretch out to its full 50-foot length when you need it and coil back up when you're done.</h3><p>There are a few scenarios in which you probably shouldn't opt for a coil-style garden hose. If you need to use your hose for a sprinkler that rests on the lawn, this design is a bad pick. If you need to run high-pressure water through your hose, same story. For just about everything else, however, a coiled hose gives you the reach you need when you need it and stores away in significantly less space than a traditional rubber or vinyl garden hose, with no laborious winding or looping needed to stow it away.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0793J5QG9/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0793J5QG9&#38;linkId=7257ebb6db907277d9244b368ef81d3e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Orbit 26380 50-Foot Coil Hose</a> is a great choice for your next coiled hose because it's a good price, it's of good quality, and because it comes with a sprayer head. For watering potted plants on a porch, balcony, or patio; for irrigating small patches of lawn or garden beds; or for spraying down a car in the driveway, this hose gives you reach and easy control, and then it coils itself right back up again when you don't need it anymore.</p><p>I do have to note that some users report leaking problems, many of which I suspect were caused by too much water pressure.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Self-coiling for easy storage, comes with sprayer head, lightweight design</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Occasional leaking issues, not suitable for all applications</p>\n\tThe best expandable garden hose\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ee38f06988ee325ae36c023?format=jpeg\" alt=\"aterod garden hose\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PJ49J9J/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PJ49J9J&#38;linkId=566e459d31984c371a894a8af74a6f45\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Aterod Expandable Garden Hose</a> extends out to a full 50 feet when water is flowing through it, yet contracts back to a mere 17-foot length again after use.</h3><p>You've probably seen TV commercials for hoses like this, right? You hook them to a spigot, turn on the flow, and that \"short\" hose starts to stretch out, eventually doubling or even tripling the length as if by magic. Well, that magic is just the inherent elasticity of latex and the clever design of a knit polyester cover. The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PJ49J9J/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PJ49J9J&#38;linkId=566e459d31984c371a894a8af74a6f45\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Aterod Expandable Garden Hose</a> is one of the finest examples of these hoses around.</p><p>It delivers plenty of water pressure for most common residential and light commercial tasks, from car washing to watering gardens to hosing off decks or driveways, and it has a 50-foot reach when in operation yet measures just 17 feet long when \"dry,\" so it takes up minimal storage space.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PJ49J9J/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PJ49J9J&#38;linkId=566e459d31984c371a894a8af74a6f45\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Aterod Expandable Garden Hose</a> features durable, rust-resistant brass fittings and has a convenient on/off valve built into the end of the hose. It also comes with a removable spray head with nine modes ranging from a light shower to a powerful stream. If you need a relatively long hose but don't want to deal with a large, hulking piece of hardware, this just might be the one for you.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Requires minimal storage space, features built-in shut-off valve, comes with a spray nozzle, lightweight and flexible</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Extending and retracting processes wastes water, can crack if left in extreme temperatures</p>\n\tThe best steel hose\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d3f8760bf1f0028079840?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best garden hose\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07H2SXM8C/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07H2SXM8C&#38;linkId=16cf22724328197084256ec33cc90202\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Tardigrade 50-Foot Steel Hose</a></strong>&#160;is durable enough to resist punctures from dog bites, rakes, and more while staying affordable.</h3><p>If you have rambunctious kids or pets prone to cause hose damage, or if you need a hose for a high traffic area like a garden nursery open to the public, this tough hose is a fine choice.</p><p>Looking at the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07H2SXM8C/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07H2SXM8C&#38;linkId=16cf22724328197084256ec33cc90202\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Tardigrade 50-Foot Steel Hose</a>, you would probably think the most notable thing about it was the fact that the exterior of the hose is constructed entirely from bands of stainless steel. Indeed that's a fine feature. The hose resists damage from dog bites, crushing, and even encounters with tools like shovels or rakes. (Don't try mowing over it. It will still probably lose.)</p><p>On learning that the hose can easily tolerate high water flow such as might be used for pressure washing, you might think its capabilities were the real selling point. But in fact, it's the affordable price point that ultimately sells this hose. It's an excellent value compared to some other steel hoses on the market.</p><p>It also manages to be extremely lightweight considering its steel housing. The whole 50-foot hose weighs just under five pounds when dry, so positioning it on your lawn won't be a headache. Of course, that weight goes up considerably when you add water.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Low price, resists damage, high water volume, lightweight for a steel hose</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Vulnerable to cracking at connectors</p>\n\tThe best irrigation hose\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d3ffe60bf1f0028079841?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best garden hose 2\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lowe&#39;s</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07P9FCR7D/ref=as_li_tl?imprToken=cYkqSnisLw.8Rjvvqn4R9g&#38;slotNum=29&#38;ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=w61&#38;creativeASIN=B00BX21RPQ&#38;linkId=ab4431acefc90b8b34f58ca850f26f81&#38;th=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Melnor Flat Soaker Garden Hose</a> delivers a slow, steady drizzle of water to tree roots, garden beds, planter boxes, or even to small patches of grass.</h3><p>While all garden hoses can, of course, be used for irrigation of plants, flowers, turf, and so on, a standard garden hose is not referred to as an irrigation hose. That's a classification reserved for hoses like the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07P9FCR7D/ref=as_li_tl?imprToken=cYkqSnisLw.8Rjvvqn4R9g&#38;slotNum=29&#38;ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=w61&#38;creativeASIN=B00BX21RPQ&#38;linkId=ab4431acefc90b8b34f58ca850f26f81&#38;th=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Melnor Flat Soaker Garden Hose</a>, which features a permeable exterior that allows water to slowly but steadily leak out all along its length.</p><p>This design allows you to weave the hose among rows of flowers or food plants, to coil it loosely around the base of a tree, or to snake it up into planter boxes or along the edge of a strip of grass or ground cover.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07P9FCR7D/ref=as_li_tl?imprToken=cYkqSnisLw.8Rjvvqn4R9g&#38;slotNum=29&#38;ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_041118_best-garden-hoses-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=w61&#38;creativeASIN=B00BX21RPQ&#38;linkId=ab4431acefc90b8b34f58ca850f26f81&#38;th=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Melnor Flat Soaker Garden Hose</a> can be used in place of much more expensive and invasive irrigation systems, and it can be moved around or removed entirely as needed, unlike more permanent watering hardware.</p><p>While this hose is going to prove entirely ineffective for powering a sprinkler or pressure washing a front stoop, it's a superlative choice for keeping plants, flowers, trees, shrubs, and patches of ground cover watered and healthy.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Provides ideal irrigation, durable construction</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not suitable for use with sprinklers or sprayers</p>\n\tCheck out our other gardening gear guides\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a9032123c314b26008b46a9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bionic gloves\" height=\"961\" width=\"1281\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bionic</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-gardening-tools/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best gardening tools</a></h3><p>Having the essential gardening tools ready in your shed or garage makes the work even more of a joy, instead of a chore. That's why we've gathered up a collection of <a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-gardening-tools/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best tools for a variety of gardening needs</a>.<a href=\"http://amzn.to/2CDyTSS\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"></a></p><hr /><h3><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-gardening-gloves/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best gardening gloves</a></h3><p>Gardening isn't for the faint of heart &#8212; pulling weeds, tilling the earth, and digging up roots is sweaty work, and it really does a number on your hands. To protect yourself from dirt, thorns, chemicals, and other irritants; you need a good pair of gardening gloves. These are our top picks for <a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-gardening-gloves/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best gardening gloves</a>.</p><hr /><h3 id=\"piano-inline\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-shovel\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best gardening shovels</a></h3><p>While a shovel is undeniably not a sexy or exciting purchase, this utilitarian workhorse belongs in the tool shed of every gardener, whether that garden is a few potted plants, or an extensive vegetable garden. Whether you're looking for a spade, a trowel, a scoop, or you yet don't know the difference between them, we're here to help you find <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-shovel\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best gardening shovel</a> for your purposes.</p><hr /><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-rake\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best rakes</a></h3><p>From clearing fallen leaves to prepping garden beds for a new season of planting, a rake is more of a year-round tool than many realize. You'll want a durable one that can withstand hitting a stray rock or two without bending or breaking. These are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-rake\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best rakes</a> you can buy.</p><hr /><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-electric-lawn-mower\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best electric lawn mowers</a></h3><p>Electric lawn mowers are ideal if you have minimal storage space and don't want to deal with the hassle of storing gasoline and oil. Electric mowers tend to weigh much less than their gas-powered counterparts, so they can be easier to transport and use. Plus, they have a push-button start, so no more yanking a starter cord to turn on the engine. If you're ready to make the switch, these are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-electric-lawn-mower\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best electric lawn mowers</a>.<a href=\"http://homedepot.sjv.io/c/196318/456723/8154?subId1=biipgf_040119_best-electric-mowers&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.homedepot.com%2Fp%2FRYOBI-38-in-75-Ah-Battery-Electric-Rear-Engine-Riding-Lawn-Mower-RY48110%2F300246266&#38;subid2=1555686338510ac1y3b90w\" 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"Meet 2019's Rising Stars of Wall Street from firms like Goldman Sachs, Blackstone, and Apollo shaking up investing, trading, and dealmaking","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/8-31-2020-bi-prime-wall-street-rising-stars-investing-trading-dealmaking-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d8d277d2e22af69653b083b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"rising star at wall street thumbnail 2x1\" height=\"600\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">NYSE; Edison Partners; Tradeweb; Ruobing Su/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Meet the 2019 class of Wall Street's rising stars.</p><p>From starting a hedge fund before age 30 to running their own alternative-data shops and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-lses-27-billion-purchase-of-refinitiv-came-together-2019-8\">helping lead $27 billion investments</a>, this group of young finance leaders is in a league of its own.</p><p>It was harder than ever this year to select just 25 people. Our selection criteria: We asked that nominees be 35 or under, based in the US, and stand out from their peers. Editors made the final decisions.</p><p>Here's our list of the next crop of Wall Street leaders.</p><p><em>Additional reporting by Alex Morell, Bradley Saacks, and Dakin Campbell.</em></p><h1><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bi-prime-rising-stars-of-wall-street?IR=T&itm_source=businessinsider&itm_medium=content_marketing&itm_campaign=content_marketing_leadgen_link&itm_content=leadgen_teaser&itm_term=leadgen_teaser-rising-stars-of-wall-street&vertical=banking#!/&#38;vertical=banking#!/\">Click here to read the full list.</a></h1>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tAdam Parker, 34, Center Lake Capital\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d920d452e22af4506661564?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Adam Parker\" height=\"2274\" width=\"3032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Adam Parker&#39;s Center Lake Capital focuses on tech companies.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Center Lake Capital</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Adam Parker has been focused on running his own hedge fund as long as he can remember &#8211; and he's already running $350 million before the age of 35 with his fund, Center Lake Capital.&#160;</p><p>Parker started investing in college after he sold a GrubHub-like company he and a couple friends started. From there, he interned at the Lehman Brothers real-estate group in summer 2007 and was choosing between returning for a full-time position or joining the now shuttered Force Capital. He chose Force.&#160;</p><p><span>After working as an analyst, he eventually interviewed with billionaire Stanley Druckenmiller, and worked for Duquesne Capital until Druckenmiller closed the fund. He then went to PointState Capital, which was started by Duquesne veterans, and became a portfolio manager after just a year, running $150 million to start out.</span></p><p>Center Lake launched in 2014 with multiyear commitments from a few critical investors, Parker said. Now he believes the firm has differentiated itself because of the concentrated investments and specific focus within the tech world.&#160;</p><h1><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bi-prime-rising-stars-of-wall-street?IR=T&#38;itm_source=businessinsider&#38;itm_medium=content_marketing&#38;itm_campaign=content_marketing_leadgen_link&#38;itm_content=leadgen_teaser&#38;itm_term=leadgen_teaser-rising-stars-of-wall-street&#38;vertical=banking#!/\">Click here to read the full list.</a></h1>\n\tEvan Feinberg, 32, Tiger Global\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d8b82fd2e22af34e21cab3f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Evan Feinberg\" height=\"3648\" width=\"5472\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Evan Feinberg has helped Tiger Global become a well-known name in the private markets.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tiger Global</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Feinberg started at the University of Pennsylvania with plans to be a lawyer and had no idea what investment banking even was. It took only a year for him to transfer into the Wharton business program, and the rest is history.</p><p>Feinberg worked at Morgan Stanley during the summer of the financial crisis and joined Silver Lake Capital, a private-equity firm in New York, after he graduated. He joined Tiger Global six years ago as the hedge fund run by the billionaire Chase Coleman decided to expand more into the private markets.&#160;</p><p>In that time, Feinberg estimates he has been a part of 40 to 50 different investments Tiger Global's private-investing team has made, including co-leading the firm's investments in the Brazilian financial-technology unicorn Nubank and the buzzy workout company Peloton. Both the investments were made earlier on in the companies' histories &#8212; series B for Nubank and series A for Peloton &#8212; a fact Feinberg is proud of.</p><p>Feinberg is looking for founders that are inspirational but also grounded, so they don't let their vision get the best of them, while also being able to get employees and investors to buy into the potential of the company.&#160;</p><h1><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bi-prime-rising-stars-of-wall-street?IR=T&#38;itm_source=businessinsider&#38;itm_medium=content_marketing&#38;itm_campaign=content_marketing_leadgen_link&#38;itm_content=leadgen_teaser&#38;itm_term=leadgen_teaser-rising-stars-of-wall-street&#38;vertical=banking#!/\">Click here to read the full list.</a></h1>\n\tWant to meet the rest of Wall Street's rising stars?\n\t\n\t<p>BI Prime publishes dozens of exclusive stories like this every day that feature in-depth industry and market analysis.&#160;</p><h1><a 21:01:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5d8d27a82e22af0de20e24fa?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"bead73b9633bdd95c6ffecf349eeea12","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn24@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-08-250_cea03d9ed187a9f3.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":120044,"destBytes":120044,"author":"ddefrancesco@businessinsider.com (Dan DeFrancesco,Casey Sullivan,Meghan Morris)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d8d277d2e22af69653b083b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn47@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-09-345_a329c7f0d9557574.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d920d452e22af4506661564?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn77@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-15-116_2cad53403ded9c1e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d8b82fd2e22af34e21cab3f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn30@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-921_848fa55dc4e64651.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=vEjUaJz5uIY:svhBSamCZYU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn45@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-14-041_5331c3a119bf68cc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-200_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-13-332_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=vEjUaJz5uIY:svhBSamCZYU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn80@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-22-635_34a3d0d64e146c35.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/vEjUaJz5uIY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn82@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-10-711_e9460a5ad11a6b6d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683392},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"The US and China are headed for competition but not a Cold War","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-china-competition-not-cold-war-21st-century-geography-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c5dfbf7598e2348e0024930?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump China\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump and first lady Melania visit the Forbidden City with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters/Jonathan Ernst</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>The emerging geographical perspective of the 21st century is still slightly out of focus.</li><li>But what is certain is that it will revolve around China and the US, locked in competition for that pivotal position in the world system, writes Rodger Baker, senior VP of strategic analysis at Stratfor.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>The geographical perspective of the 21st century is just now being formed. And at its heart is a rivalry between China and the United States to succeed Europe's 500-year centrality in the international system, which will be framed by a shift in global economic activity and trade, new energy resource competition, a weakening Europe and Russia, and a technological battle to control information.</p><p>The new map of the next century will extend to the ocean floor for resources and subsea cables, to space where low-Earth orbit satellites drive communications, and into the ill-defined domain of cyberspace.</p><h2>Who sits at the pivot to the new geography?</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b1b53771ae66224008b4ba5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"EU, European Union, France, Europe\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Greg Sandoval/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>As the 21st century dawned, Europe's centrality to the world system was already beginning to fade, despite the economic heft of the European Union.</p><p>The collapse of the Soviet Union left a weakened Russia and several newly independent or restored states, significantly reducing the chances for major conflict in Europe and curtailing fear of a Eurasian heartland power.</p><p>China stood on the verge of a massive economic boom, having recovered from the global strictures following the Tiananmen Square incident. Trans-Pacific trade had already overtaken trans-Atlantic trade several decades earlier, and the US \"victory\" in the Cold War left the United States an apparently unchallengeable global hegemon.</p><p>The September 11 attacks in 2001, the global financial crisis in 2007-2008 and the current COVID-19 pandemic have all blunted that sense of American invincibility. But it can still be argued that the United States has emerged as the pivot of the world system for this new century &#8212; the crossroad between Europe and Asia, between the Atlantic and Pacific.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2d98877924a102a14a61f9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"capitol building\" height=\"1404\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Capitol building in Washington DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Terraxplorer/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The United States, while managing social and political instability at home, remains the largest single economic or military power on the planet. And despite laments to the contrary, there is still a robust innovative culture and even a manufacturing base.</p><p>Across the Pacific, <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/china-s-rise-global-power-reaches-its-riskiest-point-yet\">China is proffering itself as the heart of 21st-century geography</a>. Its Belt and Road Initiative connects a massive pool of resources, human capital and consumer markets in Europe, Africa and Asia by land and sea. Its trade and transit arms reach across the Arctic, Pacific and Indian oceans, and spiderweb across Asia and Europe.</p><p>China's centralized government and economic model, emerging military might and massive population position it as the peer competitor to the United States. Increased economic and military power brings with it political sway, and China is actively seeking to reshape global norms and regulations to <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/challenging-inevitability-liberal-world-order\">better fit its geopolitical perspective and interests</a>.</p><h2>Competition, but not a Cold War</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/553575396bb3f7b20d84a8a9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"US South China Sea\" height=\"2769\" width=\"4246\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US Navy aircraft carrier USS Nimitz, guided-missile cruiser USS Chosin, guided-missile destroyers USS Sampson and USS Pinkney, and the guided-missile frigate USS Rentz in the South China Sea.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.flickr.com/photos/usnavy/5506117357/in/photolist-eBRz96-eBS71e-eRJvNo-cvFW7U-qKd2p3-aD1JkD-eBRFXa-eBSgGp-adyHMV-gRv9Dh-ckrQBY-cuxJQE-f1dkZc-btdfEY-9oyhRT-mfDQa2-nUJvpY-dUjpmu-gXNdtE-eRxeog-cwfq8j-ayB3Lc-muP7wD-cvFW5C-eBVUhd-cktc1u-dx2RAY-dcbFLe-dcbFKa-dcbGqh-dcbFDr-dcbGzj-dx2RYL-adhMmX-dwWn3P-hnyB3d-bG85Cn-dx2RKy-nkToW1-avu5ZN-btGLYZ-avu2UL-abQYgU-bScU68-bDiby7-bDibus-chyZK3-avrouT-a64uAY-9DVuAh\" target=\"_blank\">US Navy</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>China and the United States are in a <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/us-china-ideological-divide-and-challenge-cohesion\">contest for the central role in an international system</a>, in a world where, despite resurgent economic nationalism, true decoupling will be difficult, if not impossible.</p><p>The Cold War splitting of the world into blocs was facilitated by a unique moment in history &#8212; the emergence of an existential rivalry at a time when the international system itself lay in rubble following decades of war across Europe and Asia.</p><p>In excluding the Soviet Union and its allies from the new economic system, the United States was not necessarily decoupling with Russia, but was merely omitting it from a new financial architecture.</p><p>There is no such crisis to facilitate an easy breaking of economic bonds with China. While the United States has grown accustomed to using sanctions as an economic tool of political coercion, it has mostly been against much smaller and often marginalized nations &#8212; and success of this sanctions-heavy strategy has been mixed at best.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e20be6d24306a44814a5433?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trump china\" height=\"2294\" width=\"3441\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Trump and Chinese Vice Premier Liu He hold a signed trade agreement at the White House, January 15, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Evan Vucci</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/limits-us-china-financial-divorce\">China and the United States have complex and tightly integrated economies</a>, from $650 billion in annual trade to reciprocal portfolio holdings and investments, sourcing of materials, and parts and labor in supply chains. It is not simply a few threads to cut. It is a complex tapestry that resists rending.</p><p>Unlike the calamity of World War II, the international system is only fraying at the edges now, not completely unraveling, despite the economic and pandemic crises of the last two decades.</p><p>The United States and its partners may cut some strands with China, <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/us-broadens-its-tech-battle-china\">focused mainly on high-end technology over national security concerns</a>, but it would take decades of concerted effort and economic pain to tease apart the bulk of trade ties.</p><p>Supply chains will be reformulated, technological competition will begin to fragment cyberspace, and <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/malaysian-rare-earth-processing-plant-looms-large-us-china-trade-spat\">competition for critical raw materials will increase</a>, but there is little room for the complete decoupling of major economies, despite current US-Chinese frictions or fears of a no-deal British exit from the European Union.</p><h2>Shifting geographic perceptions</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dfb84dd855cc235627a5746?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: Container ship RDO Concord sails through the Suez Canal as Egypt celebrates the 150th anniversary of the canal opening in Ismailia, Egypt November 17, 2019. REUTERS/Mohamed Abd El Ghany/File Photo\" height=\"2712\" width=\"4213\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A container ship sails through the Suez Canal, November 17, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In noting that each century has its own geographic perspective, British geographer Sir Halford J. Mackinder made an important observation in his book, \"Democratic Ideals and Reality: A Study in the Politics of Reconstruction,\" published in 1919: While geography may not change much over time, the way people perceive and interact with it does.</p><p>Technology, economic structures, and evolving social and ideological concepts all play a major role in our interaction with the physical world. The shift from wind to coal to oil had a major impact on not only the perception of distance, but the relative importance of certain geographical locations and routes. As we work to define the 21st-century geography, it is useful to look at the past, recognizing that it is the human interaction that provides perspective and defines the significance of geography at any given time.</p><p>Writing at the close of World War I, Mackinder defined the geography of the newly dawned 20th century as one centered on the \"Heartland\" of Eurasia, and on a contest of power between that continental heartland and the insular maritime powers around its periphery.</p><p>Mackinder argued that technological innovation, particularly rail, would allow a heartland power to tie together the resources and population of what he termed the World Island (Europe, Asia and Africa). With its internal lines of communication protected from seapower, the heartland would then rally its resources to outproduce and outcompete the maritime powers.</p><p>The ambitions of Germany and the Axis powers in World War II, and the Soviet Union in the Cold War, both seemed to confirm Mackinder's assessment and thus defined the geopolitical contours of the 20th century.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5672cd572340f826018b654d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"fdr stalin churchill yalta\" height=\"2209\" width=\"2912\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Franklin Roosevelt, British Prime Minister Winston Churchill, and Soviet Premier Joseph Stalin at the Yalta Conference in February 1945.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/File</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The defining geographic characteristic of the 19th century was the impact of the industrial revolution on socio-economic patterns and international trade, with a surge in urbanization, the specialization of production and expanding supply lines for raw materials and markets.</p><p>But the groundwork for the global cataclysms of the 21st century was also being set in motion. Continental-maritime rivalries between the United Kingdom and Russia played out in the Great Game, and global exploration filled in much of the remaining empty space on maps, leaving little buffer space between nations.</p><p>As the century drew to a close, early signs of a future challenge to Europe's centrality were appearing. The United States shifted radically from a continentalist to an internationalist position, highlighted in the 1898 Spanish-American War, and Japan overturned the old continental order, supplanting a waning China as the central power in Asia.</p><p>We could walk back further, seeing the massive surge in trans-Atlantic trade in the 18th century as defining a new center to an emerging world system, with vast Atlantic replacing the closed Mediterranean as the central connector.</p><p>What preceded was the 17th century, defined by the Peace of Westphalia treaties and the emergence of the modern state, with sovereignty over people, economics and territory. And before that was the 16th century, which saw the emergence of the interconnected world writ large &#8212; made manifest not so much in European conquest, as perhaps in the massive Japanese invasion force trying to push through Korea at the end of the century, armed with European arquebuses in an attempt to overturn a Chinese world order.</p><h2>Influences on 21st-century geography</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/546f7e9ceab8eafa0665ad2d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"putin xi\" height=\"1956\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Russian President Vladimir Putin with Xi at the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation forum.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kim Kyung-Hoon/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The United States and China will sit at the forefront of the 21st-century geography, with the United States remaining a traditional maritime power, as China works <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/revisiting-geopolitics-china\">to bridge a continental and maritime role</a>. Europe and Russia will both retain power and influence, though to a lesser degree, and while they may lean toward the larger poles, they will not fall into locked alliances.</p><p>Russia may align with China, but Chinese initiatives in the Arctic, Central Asia and into the Indian Ocean and Middle East are all encroaching on areas of traditional Russian interests. While Europe and the United States may align on many issues, Europe is also increasingly integrated into transcontinental land-based trade routes and at odds with the United States on regulatory fronts, from taxation to cyberspace to environmental regulations.</p><p>The formative technologies of the 21st century will also include another shift in energy, leaving some areas less important, and others emerging as the center of resource competition, <a href=\"https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/us-looks-mine-moon-its-own-terms-space-race-china-lunar-resources-exploration\">including on the seafloor and potentially in space</a>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c0053d7dde8676d7d051cd9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trump china\" height=\"1333\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump\n<p class=\"copyright\">Andy Wong/AP Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Localized power production, whether through wind and solar or through nuclear microreactors, will open opportunities in disconnected areas, from the Arctic to the highlands of Indochina.</p><p>Agricultural sciences will further change the relationship between populations and land, adapting to changing climatic patterns and urbanization trends. Biomedical technologies will mitigate some of the demographic challenges of aging populations, overturning traditional economic models that preference the continued enlargement of labor pools.</p><p>Space will become the new battleground for competing routes of information flow, and competition will extend into the physical infrastructure and the ethereal concepts of cyberspace. Hypersonics will further decimate the impact of distance, and the expansion of autonomous weapon systems will again alter the geography of war.</p><p>This emerging geographical perspective of the 21st century is still slightly out of focus. But what is certain is that it will revolve around China and the United States, locked in competition for that pivotal position in the world system.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original 22:09:10 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5c004331e1f88b0427498d98?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d4b99e5dff3e7a127464fda61fba6975","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn91@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-08-008_094d6a52c88cf8de.webp","destWidth":1778,"destHeight":1334,"sourceBytes":84428,"destBytes":84428,"author":"insider@insider.com (Rodger Baker, Senior VP of Strategic Analysis,)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5c5dfbf7598e2348e0024930?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn27@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-17-313_4330e7f076fe92c3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5b1b53771ae66224008b4ba5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn43@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-24-931_2cbb2ab9dd7ec8b8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f2d98877924a102a14a61f9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn5@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-13-672_cf2d8a0ede0bd949.webp","https://i.insider.com/553575396bb3f7b20d84a8a9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn64@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-16-688_a08f1ec14881d785.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e20be6d24306a44814a5433?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn72@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-09-548_64f8cc4f6fcf8200.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dfb84dd855cc235627a5746?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn51@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-18-644_bf30d8bc932d74cf.webp","https://i.insider.com/5672cd572340f826018b654d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn67@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-16-928_f7095b3f37ec4411.webp","https://i.insider.com/546f7e9ceab8eafa0665ad2d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn86@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-13-640_86c6e472b4abfb08.webp","https://i.insider.com/5c0053d7dde8676d7d051cd9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn20@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-17-128_6d2e626efff393fb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=lOw46mUXOBg:G0DL7DuQ5OE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn14@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-16-543_4562a1b1999a1815.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-200_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-13-332_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=lOw46mUXOBg:G0DL7DuQ5OE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-24-585_54ded205c1e1e903.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/lOw46mUXOBg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn68@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-20-709_c64ec362c343cae7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683389},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"How to contact your Uber driver before and after your trip, to arrange pick-up and report lost items","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-contact-uber-driver","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d6c457ffa48002894d438?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Someone waiting for an Uber with phone in hand\" height=\"1472\" width=\"2944\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to contact an Uber driver.\n<p class=\"copyright\">agil73/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>You can contact your Uber driver either before or after your ride has been completed.</li><li><strong>You can send a text message to your driver through the Uber app, or contact them with an anonymized phone number once your driver has confirmed your ride.</strong></li><li><strong>If you've left an item in the vehicle, Uber will let you contact the driver to have the item returned to you.</strong></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories.</a></li></ul><p>Uber has made getting a ride from anywhere as easy as a few quick taps on your phone. But aspects of the ride-hailing experience &#8212; from arranging your pick-up location to retrieving a phone you may have left in the car &#8212; require that you be in contact with your driver even when you aren't face-to-face.&#160;</p><p>Luckily, the Uber app offers several ways to get connected before and after your trip, with a process that's exactly the same on both the iPhone and Android app.&#160;</p><p>Once you've been paired with a driver, you can send them notes through the app's message feature, or call them directly.</p><p>And if you need to get back in touch with an Uber driver after a trip has been completed, the ride-hailing company offers a way to safely and securely communicate with your driver to retrieve an item. When a driver returns an item to you, you'll be charged a $15 fee.&#160;</p><p>Here's how to contact your Uber driver before and after your trip.&#160;</p><h3><strong>Check out the products mentioned in this article:</strong></h3><h4><a href=\"https://apple.sjv.io/c/196318/435031/7613?subId1=biipg_091817_best-iphone&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Fshop%2Fbuy-iphone%2Fiphone-11e-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">iPhone 11 (From $699.99 at Apple)</a></h4><h4><a href=\"https://www.walmart.com/ip/Samsung-Galaxy-S10-G973-128GB-Unlocked-GSM-LTE-Phone-with-Triple-12MP-12MP-16MP-Rear-Camera-Prism-Black/104597743\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Samsung Galaxy S10 (From $699.99 at Walmart)</a></h4><h2><strong>How to contact your Uber driver before your pick-up</strong></h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Launch the Uber app.&#160;</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Enter your destination.&#160;</p><p><strong>3.</strong> Select the car type and tap Confirm.&#160;</p><p><strong>4.</strong> Confirm your pick-up location.&#160;</p><p><strong>5.</strong> Tap the bottom menu to bring up your trip menu.&#160;</p><p><strong>6.</strong> To send your driver a quick text message, tap the \"Any pickup notes?\" bar.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d4ae4d6100a2412fb4f7f25?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_5050\" height=\"2208\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Before you get picked up, you can contact your Uber driver right from the app.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steven John/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>7.</strong> You can either type your own message out or select from any of the pre-written responses provided by the Uber app.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d57727ffa48002894d399?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to contact Uber driver before trip 1\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Most of the pre-written responses are based on communication with your Uber drive once they&#39;ve arrived.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abbey White/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>8.</strong> If you'd rather call your driver, you can select the phone icon.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d583160bf1f00280798e4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to contact Uber driver before trip 2\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>This is now to the right of the app messaging box.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abbey White/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>9.</strong> This will bring up the automatically generated app number for your driver. Tap \"Free Call\" and then confirm the call to connect with them.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d58927ffa48002894d3aa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to contact Uber driver before trip\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>This number is not your driver&#39;s personal number and should only be used to contact them to arrange your ride or reach out over a lost item.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abbey White/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>How to contact Uber after a ride to report an issue</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>Launch the Uber app if it isn't already open on your phone.&#160;</p><p><strong>2.&#160;</strong>Tap the menu icon, pictured as three stacked horizontal lines, in the top left.&#160;</p><p><strong>3.</strong> Select \"Your Trips\" from the menu.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d570760bf1f00280798d4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to contact Uber driver after trip 7\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>This is the first option in the Uber pop-out menu.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abbey White/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>&#160;</p><p><strong>4.</strong> Tap the grey box in the top right labeled \"Past,\" and select whether you want to see your personal Past rides, Business rides, Upcoming rides, or Family rides.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d562e7ffa48002894d386?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to contact Uber driver after trip 2\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>All four options are available in this menu.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abbey White/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>5. </strong>Scroll down and choose the ride you lost your item on.&#160;</p><p><strong>6. </strong>Tap the \"Find Lost Item\" box directly underneath the trip details.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d565160bf1f00280798ca?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to contact Uber driver after trip 3\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can also reach out to Uber about safety issues on this page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abbey White/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>7.</strong> In the list of options, choose \"Contact driver about a lost item.\"&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d568c7ffa48002894d38e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to contact Uber driver after trip 4\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Other options include tips for getting your item back and what to do if can&#39;t reach your driver.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abbey White/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>8.</strong> Enter your phone number to directly reach the driver and tap \"Finished.\"&#160;</p><p><strong>9.</strong> A button with \"Call\" and your driver's name will turn black. Tap it to reach out to your driver.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d56ae7ffa48002894d390?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to contact Uber driver after ride 5\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Your number will be anonymized to protect your privacy.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abbey White/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>&#160;</p><div data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\">ljohnson@businessinsider.com.</a></p>\n<p><strong>Today's news:</strong> What marketers for top companies like Nike and Verizon get paid, which apps influencers use, and McDonald's CMO explains its partnership with Travis Scott.</p>\n<section>\n <hr>\n  <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-marketing-salaries-pepsi-verizon-unilever-nike-adidas-expedia-mondelez-2020-8\">\n    <figure> \n     <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c5326202bdd7f04632d52dd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cardi B Pepsi 2019\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\"> \n      <figcaption>\n       Pepsi's 2019 Super Bowl ad starring rapper Cardi B. \n       <p class=\"copyright\">Pepsi</p> \n      </figcaption> </img>\n    </figure></a></h3>\n  <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-marketing-salaries-pepsi-verizon-unilever-nike-adidas-expedia-mondelez-2020-8\">Brand marketing salaries, revealed: What top advertisers like Pepsi, Verizon, and Unilever pay employees, from strategists to CMOs</a></h3>\n </hr>\n</section>\n<ul>\n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-marketing-salaries-pepsi-verizon-unilever-nike-adidas-expedia-mondelez-2020-8\">Tanya Dua and Patrick Coffee analyzed the US Office of Foreign Labor Certification's disclosure data to see what large brands pay their marketing employees.</a></li>\n <li>As ad agencies continue to shed thousands of jobs due to the pandemic, more brands are taking their marketing in-house and hiring marketing talent.</li>\n <li>Burger King paid a senior digital marketing director a base salary of $140,000, and Mondelez's CMO made a base salary of $600,000.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-marketing-salaries-pepsi-verizon-unilever-nike-adidas-expedia-mondelez-2020-8\">Read the full story here.</a></h3>\n<hr>\n <p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tiktok-reels-most-used-short-form-video-apps-among-influencers-2020-8\">\n   <figure> \n    <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eeb8c2d3ad8617c0d6cf4e4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"TikTok creators Théo Bignonneau, Sacha Sadok, and Rafael Caplan.\" height=\"1663\" width=\"2217\" charset=\"\"> \n     <figcaption>\n      (L to R) TikTok creators Théo Bignonneau, Sacha Sadok, and Rafael Caplan. \n      <p class=\"copyright\">Philippe Lopez/AFP via Getty Images.</p> \n     </figcaption> </img>\n   </figure></a></p>\n <section>\n  <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tiktok-reels-most-used-short-form-video-apps-among-influencers-2020-8\">A new survey of 875 influencers shows that TikTok and Instagram's Reels lead their short-form video competitors by a huge margin</a></h3>\n </section>\n <section></section>\n <ul>\n  <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tiktok-reels-most-used-short-form-video-apps-among-influencers-2020-8\">A new survey from influencer-marketing agency Obviously found that 68% of influencers use TikTok while 52% of influencers use Instagram's Reels.</a></li>\n  <li>Dan Whateley reported that only 7% of respondents said that they use Triller and 4% use Byte.</li>\n  <li>The creators who were surveyed were predominantly \"micro\" influencers with an average of around 35,000 followers on Instagram, according to the company.</li>\n </ul>\n <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tiktok-reels-most-used-short-form-video-apps-among-influencers-2020-8\">Read the full story here.</a></h3>\n <hr>\n  <section>\n   <figure> \n    <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d490760bf1f0028079869?format=jpeg\" alt=\"travis scott kylie jenner\" height=\"2069\" width=\"2758\" charset=\"\"> \n     <figcaption>\n      McDonald's is teaming up with Travis Scott (left). \n      <p class=\"copyright\">Rich Fury/Getty Images</p> \n     </figcaption> </img>\n   </figure>\n  </section>\n  <section></section>\n  <section>\n   <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-inside-story-of-mcdonalds-travis-scott-collaboration-2020-8\">McDonald's CMO says the Travis Scott collaboration is the latest campaign to cause controversy with franchisees — but that's the cost of doing business for the fast-food giant</a></h3>\n   <ul>\n    <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-inside-story-of-mcdonalds-travis-scott-collaboration-2020-8\">Kate Taylor talked to McDonald's CMO Morgan Flatley about the brand's new partnership with rapper Travis Scott.</a></li>\n    <li>McDonald's and Scott declined to share further details of their work but Flatley hinted that it may be similar to McDonald's Super Bowl ad this year that depicted real and fictional celebrities' orders.</li>\n    <li>The partnership has faced backlash though. According to a message obtained by Business Insider sent by the leadership of McDonald's independent National Operators Association, 65% of McDonald's franchisees polled opposed the partnership, citing the rapper's controversial image.</li>\n   </ul>\n  </section>\n  <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-inside-story-of-mcdonalds-travis-scott-collaboration-2020-8\">Read the full story here.</a></h3>\n  <hr>\n   <h3><strong>More stories we're reading:</strong></h3>\n   <section>\n    <ul>\n     <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/shopifys-ian-black-helps-small-brick-and-mortar-retailers-thrive-2020-8\">How Ian Black, director of retail at Shopify, is building tech tools to help small retailers compete with e-commerce giants like Walmart and Amazon</a> (Business Insider)</li>\n     <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-tech-companies-keep-adding-new-offices-while-working-remote-2020-8\">The Big Tech office isn't dead. 21:15:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5d6fdf7e2e22af2de96d1103?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"42d136ce1333f2dc428c3d044777af6e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn15@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-03-801_639b19a3137805e8.webp","destWidth":1080,"destHeight":810,"sourceBytes":64918,"destBytes":64918,"author":"insider@insider.com
