Bufete)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d6fdf7e2e22af2de96d1103?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn15@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-03-801_639b19a3137805e8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=9nkvXmP4CoQ:Wzpo0jSMjE0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn14@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-13-001_aab08b71520c3231.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-200_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-13-332_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=9nkvXmP4CoQ:Wzpo0jSMjE0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn2@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-11-623_e3e341cd6664c8d9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/9nkvXmP4CoQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn93@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-16-220_1f918c5befbbeaa2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683391},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"I fed my toddler Yumble's healthy prepared meals for a week — I recommend them for busy parents who don't have time to shop and cook","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/yumble-kids-meal-delivery-review","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow\"><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e457e3e2dae5c422a4e6068?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yumble review: healthy kids&#39; meal delivery that&#39;s convenient\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Yumble delivers healthy microwavable meals for kids that are ready to eat in less than 2 minutes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Michelle Piccolo/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>With free delivery, 20 menu options weekly, and recipes that include organic and fresh ingredients whenever possible, Yumble strives to bring healthy kids' meals into busy homes.</strong></li><li><strong>Meals cost $5.99 to $7.99 each, depending on which plan you sign up for.</strong></li><li><strong>On our first day testing <a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow\">Yumble</a>, I popped a meal in the microwave and my toddler was ready to eat in less than two minutes.</strong></li><li>Although I'll continue to make homemade meals for my son, I recommend Yumble for busy families who don't have time to shop and meal prep.</li><li><strong>All Yumble meals are prepared in USDA-inspected facilities that adhere to antimicrobial and antiviral USDA standards, which include the use of face masks, gloves, hairnets, and food-safe air purification and cleaning practices.&#160;</strong></li></ul><div id=\"ProductCard_5e0a59d6855cc209073b3f94\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e0a59d6855cc209073b3f94&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>I'm a mom of a 2-year-old son, and with my schedule, I've been able to make him dinner every night. However, is it an enjoyable, relaxing process? Not always. He's a typical 2-year-old, and most of the time, he's begging for dinner to be ready, throwing a tantrum, and I'm exhausted by the time the food hits the table.</p><p>So when I was introduced to <a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Yumble</a>, a prepared meal service for kids, I was immediately intrigued. While <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-meal-kit-delivery-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">meal kit services</a> have grown in popularity, kids' services have been decidedly limited. Yumble was founded in 2017&#160; by a mom of three who wanted to take the frustration out of meal planning and prepping by offering fresh, nutritious microwavable meals for kids who are 12 months to 12 years old. The meals are delivered weekly, and shipping is free.</p><p>Having dinner ready in less than 90 seconds seemed like a dream. &#160;Out of personal preference, I've never microwaved a meal for my son before, so this would be a whole new experience for us. &#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Yumble</a> set me up with a one-week complimentary subscription. I ordered six meals for the week, and then served one to my son for dinner six days in a row.&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tHow Yumble works\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e457f284b661b43bd299ea2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"YumbleOnline\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Yumble&#39;s weekly menu includes 20 meals that can be filtered by dietary preferences and age.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yumble</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Yumble</a> is available on the East Coast and in Texas, California, and parts of the Midwest. To start my order, I entered my email and zip code. Then I selected the six-meals plan at $7.99 per meal. There is also a 12-meals plan, which is ideal for two children, at $7.49 per meal.</p><p>After selecting the six meals plan, I picked from Yumble's weekly menu with 20 options to choose from. Most were ideal for lunch or dinner, but a breakfast and a snack option were also offered.</p><p>Each menu option included a photo of the meal and a basic description. By clicking on an item, I could also review nutritional information and ingredients in a popup window. I added items to my box by selecting the \"+\" icon.</p><p>There is also a filter to narrow down meal options, including \"gluten-free,\" \"no milk,\" \"no soy,\" \"no eggs,\" and \"vegetarian.\" Although these options exist, Yumble meals are prepared in kitchens where dairy, soy, and meat ingredients are used, so the company is unable to guarantee cross-contamination has not occurred.</p><p>Yumble does not use peanuts or tree nuts in their recipes, with the exception of coconut. But because meals are not prepared in a certified nut-free kitchen, this service is not suitable for children with nut allergies.&#160;</p><p>You can also filter by age range. Yumble said these recommendations are determined through taste tests of new menu items.</p><p>On the order page, <a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Yumble</a> listed the weekday my box would be delivered via FedEx. Once I placed my order, I received delivery status updates by email. I ordered on a Thursday, and my meals were delivered the following Tuesday afternoon. Delivery days cannot be customized at this time and are determined by zip code. Depending on a carrier's guidelines, deliveries are made by 8 p.m. or 9 p.m.&#160;</p>\n\tAll meals are delivered fresh in a sustainable box for free\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e457fdd3b62b73ef402fc14?format=jpeg\" alt=\"YumbleBox\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The eco-friendly packaging keeps food at a safe temperature.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Michelle Piccolo/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The box was insulated and packed with frozen nontoxic gel packs to keep the meals at a safe temperature during transit. I was impressed by how much could be recycled since there were a lot of components of the package: The meal trays, paper sleeves, and shipping box were all recyclable. The ice packs could be reused, or snipped, drained, rinsed, and recycled. Also in the box was a place mat, set of stickers, and deck of table discussion cards.</p><p>I placed the meals in the refrigerator immediately and made sure to cook them within seven days for peak freshness, per Yumble's instructions. The company advises against freezing meals as they may not taste as fresh.</p>\n\tHow to prepare the meals\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e4580742dae5c450c155146?format=jpeg\" alt=\"YumbleFood\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>I heated each meal in the microwave for 90 seconds, but they can also be warmed up in the stove using an oven-safe dish.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Michelle Piccolo/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Yumble</a> kids' meals come fully prepared and can be eaten cold, at room temperature, or heated in their microwave-safe containers within 45 to 90 seconds.&#160;</p><p>I normally cook or warm my son's food on the stove. If you prefer to heat one of the meals in the oven, <a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Yumble</a>&#160;said you can transfer the meal components to an oven-safe dish and heat at 350 degrees for 8 to 15 minutes. But at 15 minutes, I could just make a homemade dinner after having already done some weekend meal prep work.&#160;I opted to really test Yumble the way it is intended.&#160;</p><p>On our first day, we came home from a playdate and I popped one of the meals in the microwave, then transferred it to my son's favorite dinner plate. He was ready to eat in less than two minutes. You could always cut down on cleanup and serve the meal in its food tray, but <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/munchkin-raise-toddler-fork-spoon-set\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">my son is particular about what he eats from</a>.</p><p>That weekend, he stayed with my parents, and it was nice to send two of the meals with him so they wouldn't have to cook as many meals for him.</p><p>My only issue with the prep was that the plastic wrap on top of each meal was very hard to pull off. By the end of the week, I resorted to cutting it off with a knife. My mother had the same experience with the two meals she prepared.</p>\n\tSome hits and misses with our menu selection\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e4580e82dae5c45b20613c3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"YumbleTrays\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The meals I selected included vegetarian, gluten-free, and organic options.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Michelle Piccolo/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Out of the available options, we tried the following <a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Yumble meals</a>:</p><ul><li>Pizza Pocket and Broccoli Parm: vegetarian pizza empanada with parmesan-sprinkled broccoli</li><li>Creamy Mac N Trees: gluten-free mac and cheese with parmesan broccoli</li><li>Daisy Bolognesy: cheese ravioli with vegetable and beef bolognese</li><li>Chick N Casserole: organic chicken meatballs, wheat pasta, broccoli, and cheese</li><li>Chicken Marinara and Alfredo: gluten-free chicken nuggets and pasta</li><li>Chili Mac: vegetarian chili with gluten-free mac and cheese</li></ul><p>For the most part, my son ate everything except the Daisy Bolognesy. He didn't touch it, but he is going through a picky phase with sauce, so that could have been the reason.</p><p>The Pizza Pocket was extremely doughy and almost tasted raw, but I was pleased with the chicken nuggets and meatballs. They had good flavor and texture. The pasta wasn't mushy, and the chili had good flavor. I thought the broccoli was okay. I prefer the taste of roasted broccoli, so this wasn't something I loved, but my son ate a little bit of it.</p><p>Overall, my son ate about half of each meal (each is a pretty healthy serving), his favorite being the Chicken Marinara and Alfredo. I typically make him a main dish with two sides that he usually finishes, and there was no problem here not having enough food to give him for dinner.</p>\n\tNotes on ingredients and nutrition\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e710c97c4854074fb7d1336?format=jpeg\" alt=\"chicken marina alfredo yumble\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Yumble recipes are reviewed by a childhood nutritionist.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yumble</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>I was happy to read that <a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Yumble</a> chooses a variety of seasonal, fresh, and natural ingredients when making their meals. Organic foods are used whenever possible and noted on the ingredients list when applicable. Yumble also strives to use humanely raised, antibiotic- and hormone-free meats and is transparent about which meals include those.</p><p>The recipes are designed by an in-house professional chef and youth nutrition specialist and are reviewed by a childhood nutritionist and nutritional consultant, according to Yumble. Through taste tests with local families (both customers and non-customers), it gathers feedback on the look, smell, and taste of its meals before launching. It also monitors customer's meal ratings to remove options from the website that don't score well.&#160;</p><p>When reviewing the nutritional information for the meals I received, the sodium levels in some of the meals stood out &#8212; the highest from what I ordered was the Chicken Marinara and Alfredo (690 mg) and the Chili Mac (740mg). I try to pay attention to the amount of sodium and sugar in my son's foods and checked with an expert about these levels.</p><p>\"[S]odium is often added to enhance palatability and extend shelf-life,\" said Malina Malkani, a registered dietitian nutritionist and media spokesperson for the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics. Malkani noted that dietary reference intakes for sodium for kids are no more than 1,500 mg sodium per day for children ages 1 to 3 and less than 2,200 mg for those between 4 and 13 years old.</p><p>While Yumble's sodium levels fall within a safe range, if you give your child packaged, processed, and other high-sodium foods throughout the day, you'll want to keep an eye on their overall sodium intake. For context, an Annie's Cheddar Bunnies 28-gram snack pouch contains 240 mg of sodium and one Organic Valley's Stringles Organic String Cheese contains 210 mg. My son only ate about half of the aforementioned Yumble meals, so ultimately, it wasn't an issue for us.</p>\n\tThe bottom line\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e4581574b661b46ac560e34?format=jpeg\" alt=\"YumbleBottomLine\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The service is ideal for busy parents who don&#39;t have time to shop and cook.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Michelle Piccolo/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Did <a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/SENKSE9KS0pDR0lJTEhOQ0dNS0tHSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Yumble</a> save me time and energy? Yes. Did my son enjoy it? For the most part. Would I continue to order? Not necessarily.</p><p>Luckily, Yumble lets you skip a week or pause your subscription. I would order again if I knew a week was going to be super busy or if my son was going to stay with my parents for a few days. If I could freeze some meals for random days here and there, I would order more.</p><p>I have the time to make dinner most nights, but for many families that don't, Yumble is definitely a great option to check out if you're looking to getting a balanced meal with good ingredients on the table quickly and easily.</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Easy ordering process, delivered fresh, variety of meals to choose from, good ingredients, uses organic whenever possible</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Plastic wrap difficult to remove; need to keep an eye on sodium levels; not suitable for children with nut, egg, milk, gluten, or soy allergies</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e0a59d6855cc209073b3f94\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e0a59d6855cc209073b3f94&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 22:02:00 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"7 products created by startups as a direct result of customer requests","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/successful-products-inspired-by-customers-demands","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&u=1088116&m=74233&urllink=g-ro.com%2Fproducts%2Fbackpack-xv-classick-xv-classic\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf7dc0e11e20513f84ac957?format=jpeg\" alt=\"customer demand products 6\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">G-RO/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>\"The customer is always right\" goes the old adage. \"Always\" is a strong word choice, but retail companies can't deny the power and influence that customers can have over the product development process.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trending-products-and-startups-2019\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Agile startups</a> are often able to quickly spot and address customer demands for a new product or style.&#160;</li><li>When they work collaboratively with customers to bring them what they want, the final product is inevitably a success.&#160;</li></ul><p>Though retail companies have dedicated product developers and marketers to determine what products to release next, they do often take into consideration the feedback and requests of their loyal customers. After all, without customers, these brands wouldn't be able to succeed as they do, so it behooves them to listen with open ears.&#160;</p><p>For startups, the timeline between noticing a common customer demand and bringing it to market is sped up. Unshackled by the bureaucracies of a legacy company, the small teams tend to be able to move more nimbly and interact with their fans in more creative, efficient ways.&#160;</p><p>These conversations between brand and customer strengthen loyalties and make customers feel more like active collaborators instead of passive bystanders in the product development process. In the end, both parties win: customer gets exactly what they want, and startup is rewarded with sales.&#160;</p><h2><strong>See 7 popular startup products that were created as a direct result of customer demand below &#8212; unsurprisingly, they were hits.&#160;</strong></h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tTommy John women's underwear\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf6ba8711e205480a579632?format=jpeg\" alt=\"customer demand products\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tommy John/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://tommyjohn.evyy.net/JY7Xq\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop women's underwear at Tommy John, starting at $20</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tommy-john-new-womens-underwear-review-2018-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our review of Tommy John women's underwear here</a></h3><p>Since launching in 2008 with ultra-comfortable men's underwear and undershirts, Tommy John has been fielding requests for women's underwear. A photo of a woman wearing its boxer briefs and extolling its virtues finally convinced the founders it was time to design a collection to specifically address the underwear woes of women.&#160;</p><p>The underwear comes in three types of fabric (Air, Cotton, and Second Skin), and they're all very soft and stretchy. They never bunch, roll, or show panty lines, so it's no wonder they're our pick for the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-underwear-women\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best women's underwear</a> you can buy. Available in six different cuts, they are a little expensive starting at $20 a pair, but we feel they're definitely worth it.&#160;</p>\n\tEverlane sneakers\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf6df4f11e205515e7357d4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"customer demand products 4\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Everlane</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.pjtra.com/t/TEFNS0VFQUVHR0pGTEFFREhLRE0?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.everlane.com%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-court-sneaker-black%3Fcollection%3Dwomens-tread-sneakers\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop the Tread Court Sneaker at Everlane, $98</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/everlane-tread-sneakers-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our review of the Everlane Tread sneaker here</a></h3><p>Everlane has been making shoes like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/everlane-reknit-knit-flats-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">flats</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/everlane-day-high-heel-review-2018-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">heels</a> for years, but only introduced its brand new sneaker brand, Tread, in 2019. It's calling them the world's lowest-impact sneakers, using recycled and natural rubber for the soles, leather from a Gold-certified tannery (meaning it meets high environmental standards) for the body, and recycled plastic for the laces and lining.&#160;</p><p>Our resident sneaker expert Amir described them as such: \"The overall design isn't groundbreaking, but what makes them feel special is Everlane's ability to strip away wasteful materials while maintaining such a classic look.\"&#160;</p>\n\tMade In wok\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf6d6e111e2054dc56b6104?format=jpeg\" alt=\"customer demand products 3\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Made In</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=74508&#38;urllink=madeincookware.com%2Fproducts%2Fblue-carbon-steel-wok\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop the Blue Carbon Steel Wok at Made In, $99</a></h3><p>Made In offers top-quality cookware staples (non-stick pans, saucepans, knives) at affordable prices, but its most loyal fans still felt like their stovetops were missing an important specialty pan. It turns out everyone really wanted a wok, so a wok this <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kitchen-startups-made-in-material-tap-expert-advisors-tom-colicchio-alison-roman\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">top chef-backed kitchen brand</a> created. You can now cook up restaurant-quality stir fry right at home.</p><p>Made In's wok has a flat bottom instead of a traditionally round one, making it more practical to store, and it's made from carbon steel, a material that's lightweight, heats quickly, and also retains heat exceptionally well.&#160;&#160;</p>\n\tAllbirds flats\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cd9c347021b4c458729ff42?format=jpeg\" alt=\"allbirds vs rothys 5\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Allbirds</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=68246&#38;urllink=www.allbirds.com%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-tree-breezers\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop the Tree Breezer at Allbirds, $95</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/allbirds-tree-breezer-flats-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our review of the Allbirds Tree Breezer here</a></h3><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/allbirds-vs-rothys-flats\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">A challenge to knit flats brand Rothy's</a> has emerged, and it's proven to be a worthy competitor indeed. Though women love Allbirds sneakers like the signature <a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=68246&#38;urllink=www.allbirds.com%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-wool-runners\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Wool Runner</a> or the vacation-ready <a href=\"http://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=68246&#38;urllink=www.allbirds.com%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-tree-skippers\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Tree Skipper</a>, they also desired a more feminine silhouette, something that would let them wear the Allbirds brand even to the office or on dates.&#160;</p><p>The Tree Breezer flat features the padded merino wool insole that fans are already familiar with, paired with uppers made from a eucalyptus textile. It also has a bouncy sole made from sugar cane. Comfortable, lightweight, and machine-washable, the Tree Breezer is yet another Allbirds hit that's made just for flats lovers.&#160;</p>\n\tVolition serum\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf7d7d211e20512232803f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"customer demand products 5\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Volition</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1716809506866387580\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Shop Volition beauty products at Sephora, from $12</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/volition-beauty-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our review of Volition here</a></h3><p>Volition's best-selling <a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1716809623344047829\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Snow Mushroom Water Serum</a> ($62) isn't the only customer-requested product from the brand. In fact, the whole model of this innovative beauty brand is based on what customers want. Members of the community submit ideas for beauty and skin-care products they want to see, and they're only made if it gathers enough support from the rest of the community.&#160;</p><p>Popular products include the above serum, which hydrates skin, minimizes pores, and promotes collagen production, as well as a <a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1716809644662555001\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">daily sunscreen</a> that doesn't leave residue or odor and <a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1716809742903300046\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">resurfacing pads</a>&#160;powered by apple cider vinegar.&#160;</p>\n\tLively strapless bra\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf7fcc711e205216d690d23?format=jpeg\" alt=\"customer demand products 7\" height=\"563\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lively</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=44020&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wearlively.com%2Fproducts%2Fthe-no-wire-strapless-toasted-almond%3Fvariant%3D2464054640652\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Shop the Lively No-Wire Strapless Bra, $35</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/lively-no-wire-strapless-bra-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our review of the Lively No-Wire Strapless Bra here</a></h3><p>According to underwear and swim company Lively, when the site first launched in 2016, the most searched item was \"strapless bra.\" It gave the people what they wanted with the <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=44020&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wearlively.com%2Fproducts%2Fthe-smooth-strapless-toasted-almond%3Fvariant%3D41016319756\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Smooth Strapless</a> ($35) and followed up with an even more comfortable no-wire option. Thousands of women joined the waitlist for this secure, lightly lined strapless bra that you'll nearly forget you're wearing.&#160;</p><p>All of Lively's underwear is shockingly affordable given their quality, and when you mix and match bras and underwear, you'll save more.</p>\n\tCurology cleanser and moisturizer\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cf6c2d311e20549d53ef8f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"customer demand products 2\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Curology/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://curology.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Start your free trial of Curology, $59.90 bimonthly</a></h3><p>Curology makes it convenient to get a prescription acne cream for your skin and manage your progress with a board-certified dermatologist, physician's assistant, or nurse practitioner. At its start, Curology only provided the personalized acne treatment, which it calls its Super Bottle, but has since added a cleanser and moisturizer to make a full three-step bundle of acne-fighting and anti-aging solutions.&#160;</p><p>The non-comedogenic, fragrance-free, and paraben-free cleanser and moisturizer work together with the acne cream, so you're not sabotaging your results with ineffective skin-care products.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 01/02-18-16-047_f8633f6b777f9513.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/_Yq3JChwG90":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn17@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-16-287_2ad57843e7ac167c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683393},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"US Army officer's 'completely unacceptable' TikTok video joking about the Holocaust is widely condemned","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/army-officer-tiktok-video-joking-about-holocaust-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d53fb7ffa48002894d371?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020 08 31 at 12.45.40 PM\" height=\"519\" width=\"1040\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://twitter.com/PaulSzoldra/status/1300460657800744960?s=20\" target=\"_blank\">Twitter/@PaulSzoldra, TikTok/@_itsnate</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>A US Army officer is being investigated after a TikTok video of him making disparaging remarks about Jews and the Holocaust surfaced on social media.</li><li>The video appears to show 2nd Lt. Nathan Freihofer, who amassed nearly 3 million TikTok followers, saying he would not be verified on the app due to the nature of his \"dark jokes.\"</li><li>Freihofer goes on to say that a \"Jewish person's favorite Pok&#233;mon character\" is Ash, the name of the protagonist in the popular cartoon and video game series, in a reference to the Nazi's extermination of 6 million European Jews as part of the Holocaust.&#160;</li><li>David Lapan, a former Defense Department spokesman, told Insider the video was distasteful.</li><li>\"It is a glaring example of what the military services try to avoid in social media,\" Lapan told Insider. \"On the one hand, we encourage service members to use social media, but to do so responsibly&#160;and in ways that reflect positively on their service. This video fails.\"</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>A US Army officer is being investigated after a TikTok video of him making disparaging remarks about Jews and the Holocaust surfaced on social media.</p><p>\"We are investigating reports of a Soldier assigned to XVIII Airborne Corps allegedly making vile remarks on a social media video,\" the North Carolina-based XVIII Airborne Corps confirmed in a statement. \"The statement made in the video is completely inconsistent with our values. We will review all facts and take appropriate action.\"</p><p>In a separate statement, the Georgia-based 3rd Infantry Division also confirmed it was launching an investigation of the \"vile remarks\" from the TikTok video, adding that the officer was \"suspended of any and all leadership authorities effective immediately.\"</p><p>The video appears to show 2nd Lt. Nathan Freihofer, who amassed nearly 3 million TikTok followers and over 135 million \"likes\" on his account, saying he could not be verified on the app due to the nature of his \"dark jokes.\"</p><p>Freihofer goes on to say that a \"Jewish person's favorite Pok&#233;mon character\" is Ash, the name of the protagonist in the popular cartoon and video game series. At the end of the short video, Freihofer proclaims \"if you get offended, get the f--- out, because it's a joke.\"</p><p>\"Don't be a pussy,\" Freihofer added.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Paul Szoldra  (@PaulSzoldra) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1300460657800744960?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 31, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Freihofer did not appear in uniform during the video, but other clips on his account shows him performing military tasks in fatigues.</p><p>Freihofer is likely a new soldier in the Army. Second lieutenants are the most junior rank for newly-commissioned officers in the Army and typically have less than two years of service. The officers command platoon-size groups of roughly 16 to 44 soldiers.</p><p>Freihofer did not respond to a request for comment Monday. His TikTok account has since been removed.</p><p>Public response to the viral video, which was first uploaded by Task &#38; Purpose editor-in-chief Paul Szoldra on Monday, was swift.</p><p>\"This is completely unacceptable,\" Sgt. Maj. of the Army Michael Grinston, the senior-most enlisted soldier in the service, said on Twitter. \"On social media or not, racist jokes are racist. Period.\"</p><p>David Lapan, a former Defense Department spokesman, concurred with Grinston's assessment and told Insider the video was distasteful.</p><p>\"It is a glaring example of what the military services try to avoid in social media,\" Lapan told Insider. \"On the one hand, we encourage service members to use social media, but to do so responsibly&#160;and in ways that reflect positively on their service. This video fails.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e5ed917fee23d0a4a756e09?format=jpeg\" alt=\"US Army recruits basic training\" height=\"400\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Trainees wait to be in-processed at the 120th Adjutant General Battalion at Fort Jackson in South Carolina, October 30, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alexandra Shea/Fort Jackson Public Affairs</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Lapan added that despite Freihofer's likely nascent career in the military, his lack of experience was not an excuse for the tone in the video.</p><p>\"Quite simply, in the military, we have high expectations and place a lot of responsibility on people of a very young age,\" Lapan said. \"We enlist people in the military at 17 years old. But as part of their training process, again, they are inculcated&#160;with the values of the particular service.\"</p><p>\"We teach them what things are appropriate and inappropriate because at the end of the day, being in the military means you might have to use deadly force against people,\" Lapan added. \"You might be faced with very difficult and life-altering decisions at 17, 18, 19 years old.\"</p><p>The military has struggled with the proliferation of unflattering TikTok videos that have emerged on numerous social media apps, many of them containing service members wearing a uniform, or half-dressed in one. In one recent TikTok <a href=\"https://www.militarytimes.com/off-duty/military-culture/2020/08/27/cardi-bs-wap-causes-controversy-on-military-tiktok/\">video</a>, two US Army soldiers appeared to dance to rapper Cardi B's song \"WAP,\" prompting fierce backlash from a predominately male audience.</p><p>The US military officially banned the use of the app for its troops, regardless of whether they appeared in videos wearing a uniform, citing concerns with its ownership of the China-based technology firm, ByteDance. President Donald Trump has railed against TikTok and claimed that ByteDance \"might take action that threatens to impair the national security of the United States.\"</p><p>In 2019, Gen. David Berger, the US Marine Corps commandant, said that criticism for a service members' use of Chinese-owned apps like TikTok should be directed against the military's leadership, rather than the individual troops. Berger added that the younger generation of troops had a \"clearer view\" of the technology \"than most people give them credit for.\"</p><p>\"That said, I'd give us a 'C-minus' or a 'D' in educating the force on the threat of even technology,\" Berger said. \"Because they view it as two pieces of gear, 'I don't see what the big deal is.'\"</p><p>\"That's not their fault. That's on us,\" Berger added. \"Once they begin to understand the risks, what the impact to them is tactically &#8230; then it becomes clear. I don't blame them for that. This is a training and education that we have to do.\"</p><p><em>Madison Hall contributed reporting.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a (David Choi)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4d53fb7ffa48002894d371?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn83@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-09-593_79e034581239523c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e5ed917fee23d0a4a756e09?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn63@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-10-625_d508a85ca576aae3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=BTB-kpgWpjk:la42DaLQ-ns:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn67@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-22-632_b5d4adadf21e6ec2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-200_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-13-332_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=BTB-kpgWpjk:la42DaLQ-ns:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn90@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-11-013_cdfeaeb60c37d425.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/BTB-kpgWpjk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn47@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-24-299_2496bc1ae5b84d12.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683393},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"Trump thinks violence and chaos on the streets is good for his reelection, and he's not trying to hide it","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-thinks-violence-chaos-the-streets-good-for-his-reelection-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d56bb60bf1f00280798d2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump speaks at an airport hanger at a rally a day after he formally accepted his party’s nomination at the Republican National Convention on August 28, 2020 in Londonderry, New Hampshire.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Spencer Platt/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>President Donald Trump is actively working to incite violence and chaos in American cities, hoping he can carry himself to a reelection victory on a \"law and order\" platform.</li><li>Trump on Sunday took to Twitter to decry anti-racism protesters and praise a caravan of his supporters who rode into Portland after deadly violence followed clashes between the groups.&#160;</li><li>Biden has fervently condemned the recent violence while Trump expresses explicit support for one group over others, and paints all protesters as destructive anarchists.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"f0e80ded5d35b2778c5da3bdda2e6898\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>President Donald Trump is making no effort to hide the fact he believes that violence and chaos on the streets of American cities will boost his reelection prospects.&#160;</p><p>Trump is using his Twitter account to incite violence and fuel divisions across the country, perpetuating an \"us vs. them\" mentality among his supporters.</p><p>After deadly violence in Portland on Saturday following clashes between Trump supporters and Black Lives Matter protesters, the president took to Twitter to bash the city's mayor and decry the anti-racism protesters.&#160;</p><p>\"The big backlash going on in Portland cannot be unexpected after 95 days of watching and incompetent Mayor admit that he has no idea what he is doing,\"&#160;<a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1300010374855524352\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Trump said</a> in a tweet. \"The people of Portland won't put up with no safety any longer. The Mayor is a FOOL. Bring in the National Guard!\"</p><p>\"The only way you will stop the violence in the high crime Democrat run cities is through strength!\" Trump, who controversially sent <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-federal-agents-police-us-cities-invited-constitutional-experts-2020-7\">federal agents into Portland</a> in response to the protests earlier this summer, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1300171130326716418?s=20\">said in another tweet.</a></p><p>Trump praised the large group of his supporters who drove into Portland in a caravan to confront protesters, hailing them as <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1300019849540886528?s=20\">\"GREAT PATRIOTS.\"</a></p><p>The man who was shot and killed in Portland was <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/30/us/portland-trump-rally-shooting.html\">reportedly affiliated with Patriot Prayer</a>, a far right group.&#160;</p><p>As Trump praised the caravan of his supporters who rode into Portland, the president in separate tweet characterized protesters in Washington, DC, as \"<a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1300019490177069060?s=20\">Disgraceful Anarchists.</a>\"</p><p>The violence in Portland over the weekend came a week after the police in Kenosha, Wisconsin shot Jacob Blake, an unarmed Black man, seven times in the back. Some of the peaceful protests in the following days turned violent as people looted and defaced nearby businesses.</p><p>Armed citizens took to the streets in response to the demonstrations, which has fatal results. Kyle Rittenhouse, 17, has been accused of opening fire during a Black Lives Matter protest in Kenosha and killing two people in the process.&#160;</p><p>Trump on Sunday <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Timcast/status/1299327274710437888\">liked a tweet</a> that spoke positively of Rittenhouse. \"Kyle Rittenhouse is a good example of why I decided to vote for Trump,\" the tweet said.</p><p>The president has given a platform to conspiracy theorists, including those who claim ongoing anti-racism demonstrations represent <a href=\"https://twitter.com/OANN/status/1299045185758703616\">a \"coup attempt\" against Trump</a>, and people who've threatened protesters exercising their First Amendment rights with violence.&#160;</p><p>Experts on authoritarianism and fascism have warned that Trump's behavior bears <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ruthbenghiat/status/1300091306933391360?s=20\">unsettling parallels</a> to autocratic leaders of both the past and present.</p><p>\"Trumpism is something akin to a fascist social and political movement,\" Jason Stanley, author of \"How Fascism Works,\" <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/30/media/trump-fascism-reliable/index.html\">told CNN on Sunday.</a> \"We've got militias roaming the street. We have one of our political parties turning into a cult of the leader.\"</p><p>The president is moving ahead with a visit to Kenosha on Tuesday, despite the fact local leaders have made it clear they don't want him there.</p><p>\"I am concerned your presence will only hinder our healing. I am concerned your presence will only delay our work to overcome division and move forward together,\" Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers, a Democrat, wrote in <a href=\"https://apnews.com/0f8b184872f489a75548914049e41b13\">a letter</a> to Trump.&#160;</p><p>The Kenosha shooting came just one night after a St. Louis couple who made headlines for pointing guns at Black Lives Matter protesters earlier this summer <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/first-night-of-rnc-was-dark-all-about-spreading-fear-2020-8\">spoke at the Republican National Convention</a>. Mark and Patricia McCloskey, the gun-toting couple, in their remarks for the GOP convention said Democrats \"are not satisfied with spreading the chaos and violence into our communities\" and want to \"abolish the suburbs all together.\"</p><p>Trump and his allies have repeatedly pushed the false narrative that US cities led by Democrats are consumed by crime and destruction amid nationwide protests against racism and police brutality. While there has been rioting and violence on the fringes of these demonstrations, they've primarily been peaceful and Trump's rhetoric on this is at odds with reality. Crime in the US <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/28/nyregion/trump-rnc-urban-crime.html\">remains historically low</a>.&#160;</p><p>The president is trying to convince white, suburban voters that they're in danger of being overrun by anarchists if he loses the election, so he's going full-steam ahead with painting former Vice President Joe Biden as weak on crime and unwilling to condemn violence. Meanwhile, Trump <a href=\"https://morningconsult.com/2020/08/29/post-rnc-poll-trump-bounce/\">trails Biden</a> in the polls.&#160;</p><h2>'Rioting is not protesting'</h2><p>Biden has a fairly hardline record when it comes to crime, which is part of the reason he's not particularly popular with the progressive wing of the Democratic party, and he's taken to the campaign trail to forcefully decry recent incidents of violence.</p><p>\"Rioting is not protesting. Looting is not protesting. Setting fires is not protesting ... And those who do it should be prosecuted,\" Biden said in Pittsburgh on Monday, during a speech in which he also condemned \"unwarranted police shootings.\"&#160;</p><p>The Democratic presidential nominee also slammed the president for his \"failure to call on his own supporters to stop acting as an armed militia.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Aaron Rupar  (@atrupar) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1300492092192559105?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 31, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>To Biden's point, the White House has openly stated that \"violence and chaos\" is good for Trump and his \"law and order\" messaging.&#160;</p><p>\"The more chaos and anarchy and vandalism and violence reigns, the better it is for the very clear choice on who's best on public safety and law and order,\" White House counselor Kellyanne Conway <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kellyanne-conway-chaos-and-violence-is-good-for-trumps-reelection-2020-8?utmSource=twitter&utmContent=referral&utmTerm=topbar&referrer=twitterrrer=twitter\">said during an interview on \"Fox and Friends\"</a> last week.&#160;</p><p>By fueling violence and disarray, Trump also distracts from his disastrous response to the COVID-19 pandemic. The US has the highest number of cases and fatalities from the virus in the world, and the outbreak has left millions unemployed. Trump is trying to divert attention away from this by perpetuating culture wars.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-thinks-violence-chaos-the-streets-good-for-his-reelection-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
