Haltiwanger)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4d56bb60bf1f00280798d2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn30@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-13-865_bcdc1e202fc74ec2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=Egmkpt3F8rQ:FZF68YqKUuU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn9@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-16-303_7f26dc500d6f43cf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-200_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-13-332_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=Egmkpt3F8rQ:FZF68YqKUuU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn81@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-15-215_6a2e45a45f7e7eaf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/Egmkpt3F8rQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn43@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-18-328_8f4533cec32df6ee.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683400},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"Even chefs experience cooking burnout — here's how they get re-inspired in the kitchen","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/cooking-tips-inspiration-chefs-experts","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f490785cd2fec00296a4bdc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Get reinspired in the kitchen 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">iStock; Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>As the pandemic continues, it's become harder to maintain the same enthusiasm for cooking as we had back in March and April.&#160;</li><li>To help you get back into the kitchen, I asked professional chefs, food and drink brand founders, and cookbook authors how they continue to feel inspired.</li><li>Among many other useful tips, they recommend visiting farmers markets, trying out new and unfamiliar ingredients, consulting diverse sources of inspiration, and using small kitchen appliances to speed up the process.&#160;</li><li>See also: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-kitchen-appliances-tools\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">19 of the most useful kitchen appliances and tools, as recommended by professional chefs</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cheap-useful-kitchen-tools\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">12 essential kitchen tools you shouldn't pay more than $10 for, according to professional chefs</a><section></section><section></section></li></ul><p>The pandemic has forced us to spend more time in the kitchen than ever. And though many of us initially <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/eating-habits-during-covid#many-are-using-this-opportunity-to-embark-on-new-cooking-and-baking-endeavors-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">embraced the cooking streak</a> with gusto, the overall sentiment lately leans more towards fatigue and frustration.&#160;</p><p>I asked the experts &#8212; professional chefs, food and drink brand founders, and cookbook authors &#8212; how they overcome a cooking rut.</p><p>They provided excellent tips on where to find inspiration, how to deal with a hot kitchen if the summer weather is slowing you down, how to make the most of your leftovers, and more.&#160;</p><p>I couldn't include all of the responses, but here were the most common words of wisdom I received:&#160;</p><ol><li>Go to the farmers market or wander your local market. Let fresh produce and vibrant colors inspire you.&#160;</li><li>Roasting a whole chicken is the best way to get the foundation for an entire week's worth of meals.&#160;</li></ol><h3>If you want to order less takeout, get back into the kitchen, and revive your love of cooking, try out these expert tips below.&#160;</h3>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tFirst, embrace the rut.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f44273f89aff80028ab7a0e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"health weightloss greens vegetables veggies fruits vegan vegetarian grocery groceries fitness nutrition scale farmer’s market wellness intermittent fasting food health omad cox 59\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Personally, I recommend letting yourself hit the rock bottom of a cooking rut. When I get in these moods, I let myself order all the takeout and make all the frozen foods, until I just cannot take not cooking anymore. <strong>&#8212;Seung Hee Lee, pop-up chef and author of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/1682681149/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=f2b9004677a91a9e086cf7fd0ed6a69b&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Everyday Korean</a></strong></p><p>The most extreme way to get myself out of a cooking rut is to first make the situation I'm in so unbearable that I'm desperate to get out of it. It's easy to just coast along when it's boring but not terrible. Meal planning is something I hate, like emptying a dishwasher. But I find four or five days of eating the same thing again and again makes me crave, so deeply into my f------ soul for flavor, different textures, exciting combinations, a challenge. <strong>&#8212;Michael Zee, creator of <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/symmetrybreakfast/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">@symmetrybreakfast</a> and author of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/SymmetryBreakfast-100-Recipes-Loving-Cook/dp/157687818X/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=4aac5ee85687e362bb367d935bd5dff4&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">SymmetryBreakfast</a></strong></p><p>The first three months of the pandemic I cooked every meal every day. By the end of May, I was burnt out. I was cooking our meals, plus for my clients and my blog. It was a lot. Finally, I had to take a break and really just let someone else cook and so we ordered our first takeout meal.&#160; Let me tell you, it was glorious. Eating someone else's cooking was a breath of fresh air. After that meal, I had to get out of my head and just look for inspiration. Honestly, from someone that is always in the kitchen, the best way to get out of a cooking rut is to not cook. <strong>&#8212;Rezel Kealoha, recipe developer</strong></p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tConsult a trusty cookbook. Or pick up a new one.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47beb2db1ed0002971438c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cooking inspiration tips 7\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Simon &#38; Schuster/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>For easy weeknight meals that are guaranteed crowd-pleasers, I just love Mark Bittman's website and cookbooks. They're remarkably user-friendly and often make enough for leftovers. My favorite is \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/0470936304/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=f792d7eae7cdfacb87e33ba57e400605&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">How to Cook Everything Fast.</a>\"&#160;<strong>&#8212;Paul C. Reilly, chef and owner at <a href=\"https://beastandbottle.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">beast + bottle</a></strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f4d50a88cf5620d704b174d\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f4d50a88cf5620d704b174d&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>I've always loved reading cookbooks cover-to-cover with Post-It notes ready to go for anything that inspires me. There are two kinds of cookbooks I love the most: first, ones that empower you with foundational knowledge and skills that you can use to level-up all of your cooking and second, ones that give rich cultural or historical context to the cuisines beyond recipes.</p><p>Some of my most-used cookbooks in the first group are \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Salt-Fat-Acid-Heat-Mastering/dp/1476753830/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=5c3c6e2a8bf2eceb194e43f996704fcb&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Salt, Fat, Acid, Heat</a>\" (Samin Nosrat); \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Food-Lab-Cooking-Through-Science/dp/0393081087/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=b333a88d06f45afbd470bcf01c3aef0d&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Food Lab</a>\" (J. Kenji L&#243;pez-Alt); and \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/King-Arthur-Flour-Bakers-Companion/dp/158157178X/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=3fffb7169a611e293bfbf7b94276627d&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The King Arthur Flour Baker's Companion</a>,\" and in the second are \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Am-Filipino-This-How-Cook/dp/1579657672/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=c2fb656842b4ba22f9c900a77188964e&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">I Am a Filipino</a>\" (Nicole Ponseca) and \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Night-Market-Delicious-Facilitate-Fun-Having/dp/0451497872/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=9eef31a38d4d5a63830c284903c85c4e&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Night + Market</a>\" (Kris Yenbamroong).&#160;<strong>&#8212;Vanessa Pham, cofounder of <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=96259&#38;urllink=omsom.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Omsom</a></strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f4d51892e1d0c0d73234100\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f4d51892e1d0c0d73234100&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5f4d52f18cf5620f2c5e2b13\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f4d52f18cf5620f2c5e2b13&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5f4533d858c24d090644283c\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f4533d858c24d090644283c&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tGet outside.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47d081cd2fec00296a48c6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cooking inspiration tips 11\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Broil King/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>I love cooking completely in a location that is not the kitchen or your backyard grill. Plan a little cooking fun on your canoe in a lake, or at the top of your hike up among the wildflowers.&#160; Bring one good knife, a light small cutting board, great <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=90182&#38;urllink=brightland.co%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">EVOO</a> in a tiny travel bottle, and some salt and whatever ingredients are in season. Just the change in routine and scenery will already inspire you to think differently.<strong> &#8212;<u></u>Linda Hampsten Fox, chef and owner of <a href=\"https://thebinderydenver.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Bindery Denver</a></strong></p><p>When it is too hot to cook dinner, I try to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-gas-grill\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">grill</a> outside as much as possible. We've been eating a lot of quickly grilled shrimp in corn tortillas with avocados smashed with lemon juice and salt and it is my fave savory recipe of the summer. <strong>&#8212;Jessie Sheehan, baker and author of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Vintage-Baker-Recipes-Butterscotch-Jumbles/dp/1452163871/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=c2da36b93d139579c38e36a7f12a3d12&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Vintage Baker</a></strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5dd57398fd9db224a3198a68\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5dd57398fd9db224a3198a68&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p>\n\tWander the farmers market or a local grocery store you've never been to before.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47ba13cd2fec00296a4819?format=jpeg\" alt=\"health weightloss greens vegetables veggies fruits vegan vegetarian grocery groceries fitness nutrition scale farmer’s market wellness\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Removing the boundaries around what you cook can be helpful and inspiring! On a weekday afternoon, go to a new market or grocery store, with no agenda or shopping list, and wander. Just see if you can build a dish or meal out of an ingredient that speaks to you, like a gorgeously ripe heirloom tomato, smoked duck breast, or chili oil. <strong>&#8212;Kim Pham, cofounder of <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=96259&#38;urllink=omsom.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Omsom</a></strong></p><p>I always find inspiration by visiting my local farmers market and getting inspired by what is in season. Talking with the farmers and finding what they're excited about is a surefire way to build excitement in yourself and kick-start some culinary ideas. <strong>&#8212;Paul C. Reilly, chef and owner at <a href=\"https://beastandbottle.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">beast + bottle</a></strong></p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tTry new spices and techniques.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47c94dcd2fec00296a48a1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cooking inspiration tips 9\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Omsom/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>A game-changer to get myself cooking more has been finding a few spices that I love that I know will make anything I cook taste good. My faves right now are the onion salt from Trader Joe's, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-food-drink-products-right-now#starter-ingredients-for-beloved-southeast-asian-dishes-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Asian-inspired spice kits from Omsom</a>, and a couple Tunisian spice mixes my mom sent me during quarantine. Throwing these on top of whatever I'm making, whether it's a quick stir fry or a salad, gets me so much more excited to eat it knowing it's going to be that much more flavorful. <strong>&#8212;Mayssa Chehata, founder and CEO of <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=99465&#38;urllink=www.eatbehave.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.eatbehave.com/&#38;source=gmail&#38;ust=1598384177554000&#38;usg=AFQjCNE10UH9Oy5FAi7ZWWk51AJDbIiaFw\">Behave</a></strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f22f1167924a16ea5497dd4\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f22f1167924a16ea5497dd4&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><p>Macerating fruits and veggies is my favorite trick at this time of year. Take great fruits and veggies &#8212; especially the juicy ones like tomatoes, berries, stone fruits, cucumbers &#8212; and throw them in a bowl with salt or sugar and let them sit. They will turn into something more interesting. Macerating is great for sweet or savory preparations. Add herbs, too, to create a new summer salad: the flavors meld deliciously (this is the same concept as salsa or gazpacho, for example). <strong>&#8212;Charlie Brooks, executive chef at <a href=\"https://www.sundayvinyl.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Sunday Vinyl</a></strong></p>\n\tUse a small gadget or appliance to speed up the process.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47c7e1cd2fec00296a489c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cooking inspiration tips 8\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Calphalon/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>I love my mini f<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-food-processor\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ood processor</a>. I can blitz garlic, make pesto, and whip up sauces much, much faster. Then you just toss it in the dishwasher and you're good to go! <strong>&#8212;Kim Pham, cofounder of <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=96259&#38;urllink=omsom.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Omsom</a></strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e4d7c3b2c24b627e116f852\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e4d7c3b2c24b627e116f852&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><p>Summertime is the perfect opportunity to keep the oven off and use small pieces of cooking equipment. My <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-blender\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">blender</a> is whizzing all day. For breakfast, I make nutritious smoothies to start my day off and at night I make a ton of \"nice cream\" (made without dairy) as a guilt-free treat. I'm also a big fan of using my <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-air-fryer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">air fryer</a> to make roast chicken, quesadillas, vegetables, crispy tofu, and more. <strong>&#8212;Catherine McCord, cofounder of <a href=\"https://onepotato.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://onepotato.com/&#38;source=gmail&#38;ust=1598371562145000&#38;usg=AFQjCNFrHBV-ifMU2eZkvyCSgigWDwTl7Q\">One Potato</a>, founder of <a href=\"https://weelicious.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://weelicious.com/&#38;source=gmail&#38;ust=1598371562145000&#38;usg=AFQjCNEj1KqD_8xNOFAbBrPtzOzTOcCw8Q\">Weelicious</a>, and author of </strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Smoothie-Project-28-Day-Healthy-Matter/dp/1419740423/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=e9cc4320efeba7ec8871913bc9560e8b&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"></a><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Smoothie-Project-28-Day-Healthy-Matter/dp/1419740423/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=e9cc4320efeba7ec8871913bc9560e8b&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Smoothie Project</a></strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5d543e02cd978446a776fcb3\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d543e02cd978446a776fcb3&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5d24938ba17d6c0146103b52\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d24938ba17d6c0146103b52&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>It's not super chef-y, but the Instant Pot is so convenient and a huge time-saver. You can cook big pieces of meat (like a pork shoulder for tacos, nachos, etc.) quickly or even cook from frozen. It's great for wintertime cooking but I'll also use it for rice and beans so that when I get home late I can make versatile and delicious dishes. I'll utilize beans, chickpeas, or rice as bases for grilled chicken with steamed rice and veggies and then the next day, I'll add an egg and use the same ingredients to make fried rice. <strong>&#8212;Cody Cheetham, chef de cuisine at <a href=\"https://www.tavernettadenver.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Tavernetta Denver</a></strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5cc870f40ea25505375fe7b2\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5cc870f40ea25505375fe7b2&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tMake the most of your leftovers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f44267289aff80028ab7a09?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cooking inspiration tips 6\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Porter Road</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>My go-to hack for creating second meals, or having enough leftovers to turn it into something else, is to pull your \"leftovers\" aside <em>before</em> you plate up your first meal. That way you won't eat so much you're left with a tiny useless portion, plus it's an effective method of portion control if some is already reserved for another day. <strong>&#8212;Michael Zee, creator of <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/symmetrybreakfast/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">@symmetrybreakfast</a> and author of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/SymmetryBreakfast-100-Recipes-Loving-Cook/dp/157687818X/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=4aac5ee85687e362bb367d935bd5dff4&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">SymmetryBreakfast</a></strong></p><p dir=\"ltr\">I dislike leftovers so I try to create a new meal with my leftover ingredients. Replacing the microwave with a skillet will go a long way in making them more fun and flavorful. Few meals will not taste good reheated in a skillet with a fried egg on top. Or dipped cold in aioli. Or on top of white beans cooked in olive oil.&#160;</p><p dir=\"ltr\">For instance, I always roast a whole chicken for dinner, and make chicken salad with the leftovers, and broth with the bones and my leftover vegetables. Later, I just add some noodles to them for chicken soup. <strong>&#8212;Melanie Masarin, founder and CEO of <a href=\"https://drinkghia.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ghia</a></strong></p><p>My all time favorite for this hack is to roast a whole chicken, which honestly, could not be easier. A 3-3.5-pound chicken will roast at 450&#176;F for 75 minutes. Stuff the cavity with lemons and garlic heads and boom, you're done. The first night you have roast chicken. Any leftover meat can be picked and mixed with celery, pickles, and yogurt for chicken salad sandwiches the next day. Save the bones and you have chicken noodle soup for dinner or lunch another day. It's about a $15 investment for three meals.<strong>&#8212;Paul C. Reilly, chef and owner at <a href=\"https://beastandbottle.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">beast + bottle</a></strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f453528f34d0528a23bde46\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f453528f34d0528a23bde46&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>I always think of a few things when meal planning: how can I incorporate this into either a stew, fried rice, frittata or a baked shepherd's pie of sorts. If you are reheating, I like to throw everything in the oven at 300&#176;F with a little bit of stock or water to help keep the pre-cooked food hydrated so it does not dry out. If you can incorporate water or liquid into reheating, you will always get a better end result. <strong>&#8212;</strong><strong>Joshua Sutcliff, executive chef at <a href=\"https://www.localjones.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Local Jones</a></strong></p>\n\tIf the summer heat is getting to you, stick to cold platters and dishes.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f44259889aff80028ab7a00?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cooking inspiration tips 5\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">SideChef/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>I live in Atlanta, GA and my kitchen doesn't have any ventilation &#8212; it gets hot! Whenever the temperatures go up I tend to do a lot of cold cooking: crudos and noodle dishes in particular. One of the recipes I return to often is my <a href=\"https://www.sidechef.com/recipes/47958/diy_bibimguksu_mixed_cold_noodles/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">DIY Bibimguksu</a> (mixed cold noodles).</p><p>Yes, you do have to boil the noodles for this dish, but you end up rinsing them under cold water before serving, and all of the toppings are super easy and interchangeable. If you have leftover pulled pork, pop it on! Cold cucumbers, carrots, raw tomatoes, it all works.</p><p>If you have a mandoline it's easy to make it look beautiful, but not necessary for it to be delicious. The noodle holds up really well, too. I like to make two portions and save one for the next day's lunch. <strong>&#8212;Seung Hee Lee, pop-up chef and author of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/1682681149/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=f2b9004677a91a9e086cf7fd0ed6a69b&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Everyday Korean</a></strong></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f453707a6f0e1066f0e0794\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f453707a6f0e1066f0e0794&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><p>My kitchen at home is full of beautiful, large western-facing windows, which means it is hot and sunny during summer dinnertime. Crank up the oven and a few stove burners, and it heats up fast.</p><p>At my house, we have come to appreciate the beauty of cutting board grazing! I will go beyond the normal expectations of a cheese and charcuterie display. The board is really a representation of what we have lingering in the fridge. Fresh fruits, veggies and dip, a sandwich cut in bite-sized pieces, toasted nuts, last night's roasted potatoes, maybe a hunk of crusty bread&#8230;The list is endless, but the name of the game is cold food without the pressure of tons of dishes, and letting the family graze on their own time.&#160;<strong>&#8212;Bonnie Moore, executive chef at <a href=\"https://www.blackberrymountain.com/nourish/three-sisters\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Three Sisters, Blackberry Mountain</a></strong></p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tExpand your follow lists.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47ceafdb1ed00029714419?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cooking inspiration tips 10\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">America&#39;s Test Kitchen/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>I love to watch great chefs cook and YouTube and social media have made it easier than ever to do so. I follow some of my favorite chefs such as <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/bobbyflay/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Bobby Flay</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/guarnaschelli/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Alex Guarnaschelli</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/chefaz/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Andrew Zimmern</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/marcuscooks/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Marcus Samuelsson</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/jeffmauro/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Jeff Mauro</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/chefanthony_ballatosnyc/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Anthony Vitolo</a> to see what they're cooking and how they're doing it, and also search YouTube for videos to inspire new ideas and teach me along the way, including videos of <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/c/ProHomeCooks/videos\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Pro Home Cooks</a> and <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/c/NOTANOTHERCOOKINGSHOW/videos\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Not Another Cooking Show</a>. <strong>&#8212;Daniel Kamhi, cofounder and CEO of <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=88585&#38;urllink=sardelkitchen.com%2Fcollections%2Ffrontpage\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Sardel</a></strong></p><p>The bloggers that I follow are on Instagram (<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/smittenkitchen/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Smitten Kitchen</a>) posting about their new recipes, as are the websites I like (<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/kingarthurbaking/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">King Arthur Baking</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/testkitchen/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">America's Test Kitchen</a>), the bakers (<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/pastryschiff/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Caroline Schiff</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/zoekanan/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Zoe Kanan</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/emcdowell/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Erin McDowell</a>), and the food editors (<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/ericjoonho/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Eric Kim</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/graceelkus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Grace Elkus</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/emmalaperruque/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Emma Laperruque</a>).<strong>&#8212;Jessie Sheehan, baker and author of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Vintage-Baker-Recipes-Butterscotch-Jumbles/dp/1452163871/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_082420_cooking-inspiration-tips-20&#38;linkId=c2da36b93d139579c38e36a7f12a3d12&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Vintage Baker</a></strong></p><p>I'm always out of time but rarely out of ideas! I follow a lot of chefs on Instagram &#8212; my favorites during quarantine are <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/taksekin/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Taku Sekine</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/frederikbillebrahe/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Frederik Bille Brahe</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/helenedarroze/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Helene Darroze</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/josephviolamof/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Joseph Viola</a> (from my hometown). They all have very different cooking styles and different regional inspirations, and they are generous with their techniques. My foodie friends Mia Moretti, Anna Polonsky, and Emilien Crespo and I share a lot of our recipes and techniques as well. <strong>&#8212;</strong><strong>Melanie Masarin, founder and CEO of <a href=\"https://drinkghia.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ghia</a></strong></p><p>Lately, I've been loving looking to <a href=\"https://www.101cookbooks.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">101Cookbooks</a> (Heidi Swanson) and <a href=\"https://milkandcardamom.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Milk and Cardamom</a> (Hetal Vasavada) for inspiration. I also love Brightland's own <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=90182&#38;urllink=brightland.co%2Fblogs%2Ffield-notes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Field Notes</a> where we feature recipes from chefs, recipe developers and some of our favorite entrepreneurs and tastemakers. <strong>&#8212;Aishwarya Iyer, founder and CEO of <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=90182&#38;urllink=brightland.co%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Brightland</a></strong></p>\n</div><div +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f490798cd2fec00296a4bdd?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"93509cea99a5676b6e8817addd64ae46","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-08-337_31500546b3618100.webp","destWidth":1666,"destHeight":1249,"sourceBytes":80332,"destBytes":80332,"author":"cchen@businessinsider.com Chen)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f490785cd2fec00296a4bdc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn35@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-749_eb4d448d9e1f36ea.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f44273f89aff80028ab7a0e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn24@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-22-993_56c88b8358551882.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f47beb2db1ed0002971438c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn13@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-13-636_527c83c4e21c659e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f47d081cd2fec00296a48c6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn74@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-11-184_c62bf272a696974b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f47ba13cd2fec00296a4819?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn32@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-15-683_08449ef6eaa9cffa.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f47c94dcd2fec00296a48a1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn3@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-15-431_eba394c99ef4df0f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f47c7e1cd2fec00296a489c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn29@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-10-126_448917fdf47d7750.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f44267289aff80028ab7a09?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn11@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-20-292_0c8865c1273faee7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f44259889aff80028ab7a00?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn96@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-09-124_58a6cee249700b4b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f47ceafdb1ed00029714419?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn56@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-11-138_88df3ed9ad6b4309.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=rzfWneU2QDM:ro9lgbriOw0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn42@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-22-430_4ffbe5ac6d39b899.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-200_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-13-332_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=rzfWneU2QDM:ro9lgbriOw0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/rzfWneU2QDM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn64@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-18-602_2af4e72f77a58703.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683403},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"A major internet outage on Sunday took Hulu, Amazon, and 3.5% of the world's internet traffic with it","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/centurylink-internet-outage-takes-amazon-xbox-live-hulu-cloudflare-down-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d32f660bf1f002807980a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"computer server\" height=\"3252\" width=\"4878\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BERLIN, GERMANY - JANUARY 12: Close-up of cables and LED lights in a server center on January 12, 2018, in Berlin, Germany.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Koehler/Photothek via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>A giant internet outage, due to an issue at major telecommunications company CenturyLink, wiped out 3.5% of global internet traffic on Sunday.</li><li>The outage affected web giants including Amazon and Hulu as well as individual internet users.&#160;</li><li>The outage began at 6 a.m. Eastern and ended around 11 a.m. Eastern.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>CenturyLink, a major telecommunications company, experienced a giant outage on Sunday that impacted internet users across the US. The issue, which the company says has since been resolved, caused global internet traffic to drop 3.5%, according to the internet company <a href=\"https://blog.cloudflare.com/analysis-of-todays-centurylink-level-3-outage/\">Cloudflare</a>.&#160;</p><p>The outage began at about 6 a.m. Eastern and affected individual users as well as internet-based services like Hulu, Chase, Xbox Live, Discord, and Amazon. Connection was restored about five hours later, at around 11 a.m. Eastern.&#160;</p><p>The outage comes at a time when Americans are relying on internet access more than ever. Since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, doctors appointments have become tele-visits, working from home is the norm, and students from kindergarten to college are attending classes online.</p><p>Parents like Glennon Doyle, who is an author, mother of three children, and partner to soccer athlete Abby Wambach, were concerned that the outage would impact their children's education.&#160; &#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Glennon Doyle  (@GlennonDoyle) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1300045071711186944?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>CenturyLink powers individual connections to the internet across the US, as well as connections for other web companies. Web services like CloudFlare, which provides the infrastructure for sites ranging from Reddit to OKCupid, rely on CenturyLink for connection.</p><p>So when CenturyLink went down, it created a domino effect, impacting not only its customers, but its customers' customers too, ranging from major gaming servers and streaming sites to e-commerce retailers and banking apps.</p><p>Sunday's blackout isn't CenturyLink's first major outage. In 2018, the company had an outage that lasted over 24 hours that prevented 911 phone calls for going through, according to <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2018/12/28/18159110/centurylink-internet-911-outage-fcc-investigating\">The Verge</a>. Ajit Pai, chairman of the FCC, called the issue in 2018 \"completely unacceptable\" and \"particularly troubling,\" announcing he would launch an investigation into the company.&#160;</p><p>On Sunday, CenturyLink apologized for the outage.&#160;</p><p>\"We are able to confirm that all services impacted by today's IP outage have been restored. We understand how important these services are to our customers, and we sincerely apologize for the impact this outage caused,\" the company wrote in a tweet on Sunday.&#160;</p><div Jibilian)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4d32f660bf1f002807980a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn24@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-15-966_e23fb406403373a6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=yvdf2HpNjbA:ft1Vfyg2BsA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn18@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-18-13-618_ef99b0286969e2c1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-14-200_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-18-13-332_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=yvdf2HpNjbA:ft1Vfyg2BsA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn40@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-09-394_eca68a11d0945e5c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-20-505_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-18-22-732_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-18-24-178_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-18-14-887_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/yvdf2HpNjbA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn64@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-18-19-555_fe28f024b0fa4f9f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598926683399},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:18:03","title":"My stay at Islander Resort in the Florida Keys wasn't perfect, with many guests and staff not following COVID protocols, but I'd still return — here's what you should know before booking","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/islander-resort-hotel-review-islamorada","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/travel/hotels\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d1aa97ffa48002894d230?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Islander Resort entrance\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jen Karetnick/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Florida still has a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/florida-reports-coronavirus-deaths-largest-single-day-jump-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">high positivity rate for COVID-19</a>, but in places like the Florida Keys, mandatory mask laws in place make it a good option for locals, if you're careful.</li><li>I live in Miami and decided on a road trip and staycation at the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fislander-resort.html-resort.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Islander Resort</a>&#160;because it has no interior hallways or elevators; all rooms and suites open directly outside.</li><li>Rates begin at $189, and while my stay wasn't perfect, it did impart key takeaways on travel during the novel coronavirus.</li><li><strong>Read more:&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/is-travel-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"d826cec008a7f3c5fa2e19eae976b263\">Is travel safe? We interviewed experts on risks associated with flying, booking hotels or Airbnbs, renting cars, and more, plus ideas on safe vacations during COVID-19</a>.</strong></li></ul><p>By now, it's no secret that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/florida-reports-coronavirus-deaths-largest-single-day-jump-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Florida has failed the coronavirus test</a>. After locking down when the Northeast did, we re-emerged only to find ourselves as the new epicenter of the US pandemic. Most of us shut right back up like clamshells, and the state remains a struggling hot spot.&#160;</p><p>However, six months later, Miamians &#8211; me among them &#8211; are desperate for respite. As it turns out, staying cooped up all the time isn't good for you. \"Having a sedentary lifestyle and not doing something for your own mental well-being &#8211; all these things can affect your immunity,\" Summit Health Group primary care physician Dr. Jessica Natale told me.&#160;</p><p>In other words, it's not a bad idea to safely get out of your house now and then. But that's when taking precautions, not jetting off to Europe, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/europe-travel-ban-americans-official-eu-coronavirus-covid-19-2020-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">where we're banned anyway</a>. Or even states like New York, where we're on the quarantine list.</p><p>Besides, as someone with an autoimmune disease and a dysfunctional immune system, flying doesn't seem like a good idea.&#160;</p><p>So, day trips and weekend road trips it is. And after interviewing many public health experts and physicians about how to take a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/safe-socially-distanced-road-trip\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">safe, socially distanced road trip</a>, as well as how to do so in the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/safe-road-trip-florida-keys\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Florida Keys specifically</a>, I felt confident I could responsibly leave my house for a staycation within my state, so long as I adhered to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-hotels-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">certain guidelines</a>. After all, my car is where I can control the situation, keep sanitized, and have as little contact with others as possible.&#160;</p><p>I decided on <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fislander-resort.html-resort.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Islander Resort</a> for my first trip, located on Islamorada in the upper part of the Florida Keys. It generally appeals to travelers who head to the Keys for that Jimmy Buffett vibe, family groups who want to fish and relax, and South Floridians who like to bring down their own boats (there are 14 boat slips on the property).&#160;</p><p>In the past, I've seen it get a little boisterous, but it's also been updated since my last visit, and management is aiming for a bit more elegance. I also checked the <a href=\"https://www.islanderfloridakeys.com/policies-procedures-guidelines/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">COVID-19 policies</a> and was reassured that the room would be sanitized, housekeeping would not interrupt our stay, and no one was allowed on property except guests.&#160;</p><p>Plus, there are no interior elevators or hallways. Each room or suite, equipped with a balcony or screened porch, opens out onto the 1,100-foot coral beach, a pool path, or worst case, a parking lot (my luck). Most are single-story, row-style or fashioned like villas and rooms start at just $189.</p><p>Value-wise, <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fislander-resort.html-resort.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Islander Resort</a> was well worth it, and offered the respite I needed, so long as the hotel and my fellow guests were following pandemic procedures. As it turned out, not everyone approached things as conservatively as I did, and the hotel did not fully deliver on all their cleaning promises. But my stay did impart some key wisdom on COVID safety to consider when traveling during the pandemic.</p><p>Of course, without a vaccine, there is no firm guarantee with regard to safety. It's crucial to follow guidelines and advice from organizations such as the CDC and WHO, and practice safety measures including wearing a mask, washing your hands, and maintaining social distancing. Additionally, consider your own level of risk, and whether you're traveling from or to a hotspot, so as not to increase the rate of infection.</p><p>In other words, if you're not currently living in Florida, it's probably best to consider this hotel for a visit down the line.</p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/islander-resort-hotel-review-islamorada#-1\" rel=\"noopener\">The first impression</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/islander-resort-hotel-review-islamorada#-5\">The room</a></li><li><a noopener sponsored\">Book a room at Islander Resort starting at $189 per night </a></li></ul><h2><strong>Keep reading to see why I was so impressed by <a
